0.title: 96% of daily COVID-19 cases in Karnataka recorded in Bengaluru
0.article_body: About 96% of the daily coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka on Friday were recorded in Bengaluru, according to state health department data. Bengaluru Urban and Bengaluru Rural reported 127 and one daily cases, respectively, the data showed. According to BBMP data, the positivity rate in the district was at 3.2% and the number of new coronavirus tests done was 3,970.

1.title: Ronaldo dreamt of UCL win at Juventus but they lacked something: Carvalho
1.article_body: Former Chelsea defender Ricardo Carvalho said Cristiano Ronaldo's dream was to win the UEFA Champions League while representing Juventus, but they "lacked something" to win the tournament. "The...team's strength is not enough to win the UEFA Champions League, a competition made of details," added Carvalho. Ronaldo won the UEFA Champions League while playing for Real Madrid and Manchester United.

2.title: BJP, PFI are behind Hubballi violence: Congress' DK Shivakumar
2.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has accused the BJP and the Popular Front of India (PFI) of staging violence in Hubballi. "BJP and PFI are behind (the) Hubli riots. Congress does not support (the) Bajrang Dal, VHP, SDPI, or any organisation that creates unrest in society. We are strongly committed to the Constitution," Shivakumar tweeted.

3.title: Biden's new Disinformation Governance Board compared to Orwell's 'Ministry of Truth'
3.article_body: The Joe Biden administration has announced the creation of Disinformation Governance Board. The US President's critics compared it to 'Ministry of Truth' in George Orwell's novel Nineteen Eighty-Four. "The spread of disinformation can affect border security, Americans' safety during disasters, and public trust in our democratic institutions," the Department of Homeland Security said.

4.title: Far-left hates everyone, I'm no fan of the far-right either: Musk
4.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "The far-left hates everyone, themselves included!" He added that he is "no fan of the far-right either". "Let's have less hate and more love," he further said. Musk's tweets follow his previous statement on making Twitter a "politically neutral" platform to earn the public's trust.

5.title: Ex-AAP councillor, 9 other women jailed for 7 yrs in 2015 stone-pelting case in Gurugram
5.article_body: Former Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) councillor Nisha Singh and nine other women have been awarded seven years of rigorous imprisonment for pelting stones at an Urban Housing Development Authority team in Haryana's Gurugram in 2015. Another seven convicts in the case have been awarded 10 years in jail. Notably, two more accused in the case died during the trial.

6.title: Some players are on their ego, want to only play their way: Ojha on PBKS
6.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said PBKS' players are "not learning" from their mistakes, adding that some players are "on their ego, claiming that they will only play their way". Discussing PBKS' fifth loss in IPL 2022 following a defeat against LSG by 20 runs, Ojha stated, "From PBKS' perspective, these are the games...you have to win at all costs."

7.title: Haryana govt did not set up a power plant, demolished 4: Surjewala
7.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has criticised the BJP-JJP-led Haryana government over the electricity crisis issue. "This (Haryana) government did not set up a single power plant in the last eight years and demolished four functional power plants," Surjewala said. "The CM's announcement of a new power plant...sounds like digging a well when the house is on fire," he added.

8.title: Gang murders trans person after verbal fight in Bengaluru
8.article_body: A five-member gang allegedly murdered a 23-year-old transgender person after a verbal fight broke out between them. The accused had allegedly beaten the victim Anika with wooden logs, and she later succumbed to her injuries. Anika had asked them for some money which led to them mocking her for begging after which Anika lost her cool which turned into argument.

9.title: Singer Tarsame Singh Saini, whose hit songs include 'Nachange Saari Raat', dies aged 54
9.article_body: Singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, passed away aged 54. The singer reportedly suffered a liver failure following which he had slipped into a coma. He was the lead singer of the pop band Stereo Nation. His hit songs included 'Pyar Ho Gaya' and 'Nachange Saari Raat', among others.

10.title: Stop hitting on me: Musk to US politician on 'billionaire with ego problem' tweet
10.article_body: After US' Democratic congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez took to Twitter and blamed hate crimes on "some billionaire with ego problem" who "unilaterally controls a massive communication platform", Elon Musk tweeted, "Stop hitting on me, I'm really shy." Alexandria replied, "I was talking about Zuckerberg, but ok," before deleting it. Musk recently reached a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

11.title: Kishan seems under a lot of pressure, he has gone into a shell: Chawla
11.article_body: Sharing his opinion on MI opener Ishan Kishan, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said, "Although he made a good start in MI's first two IPL 2022 matches, he has gone into a shell after that." "Kishan seems under a lot of pressure," added Chawla. "I have never seen him like this...He's playing a lot of balls and not scoring runs," stated Chawla.

12.title: Flooding is a man-made disaster, result of failed planning: BMC Ex-Commissioner
12.article_body: "Flooding is a man-made disaster," said Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) former Municipal Commissioner Ajoy Mehta at consultative session on 'Flood in Mumbai'. "We must all realise that flooding is a planning disaster. It happens because...your planning goes wrong," Mehta said. "Since it's man-made, it requires man-made solutions...this disaster impacts poor people the most," he added.

13.title: Man lets relatives gangrape wife over dowry in Raj; says 'Will make money off your video'
13.article_body: A Rajasthan man allegedly got his wife gangraped by his relatives after her family failed to pay him a dowry of ₹1.5 lakh. He filmed video of the gangrape and uploaded it online. "Your family members could not give me dowry, but now I will earn the same amount by putting this video on YouTube," the man told his wife.

14.title: Meta appeals against ban for 'extremist' acts in Russia: Report
14.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has appealed to a Russian court against a ban imposed on some of its activities in Russia due to "extremism", Interfax news agency reported citing a press release. Russia in March found Meta guilty of "extremist activity". However, it said the ruling wouldn't affect its WhatsApp messenger service in the country.

15.title: Punjab declares summer vacation in all schools from May 14 amid heatwave
15.article_body: Punjab government has declared summer vacation in all schools from May 14 amid heatwave in the state. The decision has been taken after the suggestions of thousands of parents and teachers, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said. Notably, Bathinda and Patiala on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 44°C and 43.4°C respectively. The maximum temperature in Amritsar stood at 42.3°C.

16.title: Was confused & overconfident: Kangana shares throwback pic from 'Gangster' set
16.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, who made her debut in 2006 with film 'Gangster', took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture of herself from the set of the Anurag Basu directorial film. "Throwback picture of me from Gangster days. I was just a teenager lost, confused and overconfident," she captioned the picture. 'Gangster' completed 16 years of release on April 28.

17.title: IT engineer looking for rented house cheated of ₹1.16 lakh in Mumbai
17.article_body: A 23-year-old IT engineer lost ₹1.16 lakh while looking for rented accommodation in Mumbai's Andheri East area. The victim had signed up on a real estate website following which he received a call from the accused. The caller sent him property pictures and demanded ₹2,000 as token money. He then induced the victim to transfer more money as other charges.

18.title: 19-yr-old girl, 2 others murder her 40-yr-old former lover in Pune
18.article_body: Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested a 19-year-old girl and her two associates for allegedly conspiring and murdering her 40-year-old former lover. The deceased, who is married, had reportedly intervened when the girl and one of the accused started going out. The trio apparently took the deceased to a deserted area and attacked him with a stone and iron pipe.

19.title: Chennai man gets death penalty for raping minor daughter, mother gets life term
19.article_body: A Special POCSO Court on Friday awarded death penalty to a man for sexually assaulting his minor daughter for about eight years till she was 15 in Chennai and sentenced the victim's mother to life imprisonment. The mother, despite knowing about the harassment, had allegedly warned her daughter of dire consequences if she revealed the matter to anyone.

20.title: Gang takes selfie with body after beating man to death in TN; held
20.article_body: A gang of four men were arrested in Tamil Nadu's Chennai after they allegedly beat a man to death with liquor bottles and then took a selfie with the body. The accused had reportedly killed the deceased over previous enmity and later shared the picture on WhatsApp to prove the murder to their friends. The arrests were made on Thursday.

21.title: Tourists ditching Himachal, rushing towards Kashmir, U'khand: Experts
21.article_body: Tourism experts said the hotels in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla have seen a sharp fall of about 60-70% in April as compared to occupancies in the pre-COVID years, following a drastic decline in the tourist footfall. Tourists are rushing towards more attractive spots in Kashmir and Uttarakhand as Himachal Pradesh has failed to publicise its lesser-explored destinations, they added.

22.title: After contracting COVID-19 twice during pregnancy, Mumbai woman delivers healthy baby
22.article_body: A 31-year-old Mumbai-based woman delivered a healthy baby at Wockhardt Hospital after she contracted COVID-19 twice during her pregnancy. She first tested COVID-19 positive during her second month of pregnancy and the second time during the sixth month. The hospital's doctor called it a "complex pregnancy" as the woman conceived five times in the past seven years, but suffered miscarriages.

23.title: Court criticises Assam Police for filing 'false FIR' against Mevani
23.article_body: A court in Assam on Friday criticised the state police for filing a "false FIR" against Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a policewoman assault case. It also called on Gauhati High Court to direct the police to "reform itself". The court observed that if this isn't done then, "our state will become a police state which the society can ill-afford".

24.title: Work on Hyderabad Regional Ring Road to begin in 3 months: Gadkari
24.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said the work on the Regional Ring Road (RRR) around Hyderabad will begin in three months. The northern part of the road has already been sanctioned by Centre and a Detailed Project Report (DPR) is in the final stages, he added. The proposed road will have a length of about 340 km.

25.title: 17 lakh Fitbit watches recall doesn't cover all burn-causing models: Lawsuit
25.article_body: A lawsuit has claimed that Fitbit's recent US recall of 17 lakh of its Ionic smartwatches, over reports that overheating batteries caused burn injuries, doesn't cover all similar defective models. Other versions of the device also burn users and can burst into flames, two women claimed. "Reasonable consumers...purchase the products to burn calories, not their skin," the women's lawyers said.

26.title: Loudspeaker banned not Azaan, people free to follow their religion: BJP's Shahnawaz
26.article_body: Speaking on the loudspeaker row, BJP's Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said that some people are spreading the illusion that Azaan is banned but that's not the truth. "There is no ban on Azaan anywhere in the country. People are free to follow their religion," Hussain said. "When Azaan was done for the first time, it was not on loudspeakers," he added.

27.title: Urgent need to take concrete steps to deal with coal crisis: Kejriwal
27.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said there's an urgent need to take concrete steps to deal with the ongoing coal crisis across the country. "There's a huge problem of electricity across the country. Till now in Delhi we have managed in some way," he tweeted. "Together we all have to find a solution to this soon," Kejriwal added.

28.title: Actor Yash refuses multi-crore endorsement deal for paan masala brand
28.article_body: Actor Yash refused a multi-crore endorsement deal for a paan masala and cardamom brand, Exceed Entertainment, the agency that manages endorsement deals for Yash, confirmed. "This is a truly heroic conscience call by Yash, who...declined a deal that was very personally lucrative, in the interest of his fans," Arjun Banerjee, head of talent and new ventures at the agency, said.

29.title: 90-yr-old woman, whose cake was stolen by US soldiers aged 13, gets cake from US Army
29.article_body: The US Army has given a birthday cake to an Italian woman, to replace one that American soldiers stole from her 77 years ago. Meri Mion was 13 when her village of San Pietro, near Vicenza, saw fighting between US troops and German soldiers during World War II. Mion said she would share the replacement cake with her relatives.

30.title: They looked out of the game from the 1st over: Cutting on PBKS' loss vs LSG
30.article_body: Discussing PBKS' loss against LSG by 20 runs, ex-KKR all-rounder Ben Cutting said, "It never looked like PBKS were in the game right from the very first over. They kept losing wickets at regular intervals." "We saw the ball move around when it was new and they could never really come back from there," added Cutting.

31.title: Man held for extorting money from property dealer in Gurugram
31.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly demanding extortion money, amounting to ₹10 crore, from a Gurugram-based property dealer. The suspect, identified as Manoj Kumar, was held at the Rampura flyover on NH-48 at Gurugram Sector 78 on Friday, police said. Notably, the complainant had alleged that an unidentified person was demanding extortion money through text messages and WhatsApp calls.

32.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark worldwide, becomes 4th Indian movie to do so
32.article_body: Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark worldwide, becoming the fourth Indian movie to do so. The Prashanth Neel-directorial was released on April 14. Other Indian films to cross ₹1,000-crore mark globally are 'RRR', 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

33.title: His shot was the worst: Sehwag on PBKS' Livingstone's dismissal vs LSG
33.article_body: Talking about PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's dismissal in his team's defeat against LSG by 20 runs, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "Livingstone's shot was the worst. You can hit sixes down the ground...but why get out trying to hit unorthodox shots." "Had he played even normal cricket, PBKS would have won the match with an over to spare," added Sehwag.

34.title: BHU student shaves head outside VC residence in protest against Iftar party
34.article_body: A Banaras Hindu University (BHU) student on Friday tonsured his head outside Vice-Chancellor's residence in protest against the Iftar party organised in the Women's College inside the campus. The agitation will continue until the VC apologises for organising the Iftar party, protesting students said. BHU is being radicalised with Islam and hence it became necessary to purify VC, students added.

35.title: Punjab govt transfers Patiala Inspector General of Police, SSP after violent clashes
35.article_body: After the violent clashes in Patiala, Punjab government has transferred Patiala Inspector General of Police (IG), Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) and Superintendent of Police (SP) with immediate effect. "Mukhwinder Singh Chhina has been appointed as new IG, Deepak Parik appointed as new SSP and Wazir Singh has been appointed as new SP," a spokesperson of Chief Minister's Office said.

36.title: Not much difference between governance of Yogi, Mamata: Cong leader
36.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said there is not much difference between the governance of UP CM Yogi Adityanath and that of Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "Both...have failed in maintaining a law and order situation," Chowdhury added. His reaction came after Mamata Banerjee said she will not let West Bengal become Hathras or Unnao amid recent rape cases.

37.title: T'gana CM KCR hosts Iftar party; leaders including Owaisi attend
37.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday hosted an Iftar party at Hyderabad's LB Stadium on behalf of the state government which was attended by several leaders, including AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi. "It's easy to destroy something, but very difficult to build or develop...ultimate victory belongs to humanity," Rao said. The CM's Office shared pictures of the event on Twitter.

38.title: Hanuman Chalisa arrests would've hurt Bal Thackeray's soul: Choubey
38.article_body: Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey on Friday claimed that people being arrested over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa or taking Lord Ram's name would have "hurt the soul" of late Shiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray. He added that loudspeakers shouldn't be used late at night or early in the morning. "People are facing...problems due to noise pollution," he further said.

39.title: Balcony of 2-storey building collapses in Telangana; 4 killed
39.article_body: Four people were killed and one injured after the balcony on the first floor of a two-storey building collapsed in Telangana's Yadagirigutta on Friday. The building has houses as well as shops. "The sudden collapse of the building caused injuries to those in the shops and the passers-by on the road," police said. The building is reportedly three-and-a-half decades old.

40.title: Jaideep increases his acting fee for 'Paatal Lok 2', charges ₹20 crore: Report
40.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat has reportedly increased his acting fee for the upcoming season of the crime-thriller series 'Paatal Lok'. "While the actor was paid a nominal amount of ₹40 lakh for...first season, his salary has gone up by 50 times for...second season. He's paid a handsome sum of ₹20 crore for season two of Paatal Lok," a source told Pinkvilla.

41.title: CBI arrests Central GST Superintendent, Inspector for taking bribe
41.article_body: A Central GST Superintendent and an Inspector were arrested by the CBI in Kolhapur's Jaysingpur for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹50,000. The accused have been identified as Mahesh Nesarikar (Superintendent) and Amit Kumar Mishra (Inspector). According to the CBI, the bribe was allegedly demanded from the complainant to settle a matter regarding the latter's service tax liability.

42.title: Introducing realme GT NEO 3 with world's fastest 150W charging: realme
42.article_body: realme announced the launch of realme GT NEO 3 on April 29. Priced at ₹29,999* this is the world's first and fastest 150W charging flagship which gives you 50% charge in just 5 minutes, the brand revealed, adding that the Dimensity 8100 5G processor makes it realme's first dedicated display processor. The sale begins on May 4 at noon.

43.title: Musk sells 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 bn in a week
43.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold a total of 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion this week. He offloaded about 4.4 million shares on April 26 and April 27. He sold an additional 5.2 million shares on April 28, new filings on Friday showed. The latest string of sales follows announcement of Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal.

44.title: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli buys Volvo XC40 worth ₹44.5 lakh, pic surfaces
44.article_body: SS Rajamouli recently bought a Volvo XC40 which is worth ₹44.50 lakh. A picture of the filmmaker receiving the car keys was shared online. Other than Volvo XC40, Rajamouli reportedly also has a Land Rover Range Rover and BMW 7 Series in his garage. Rajamouli's latest film 'RRR', starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR, earned more than ₹1,000 crore globally.

45.title: India reports 3,688 COVID-19 cases, 2,755 recoveries in last 24 hours
45.article_body: India reported 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 2,755 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 2,496 recoveries. Active cases in India stand at 18,684, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,803.

46.title: Fighter pilot 'Ghost of Kyiv' killed in Ukraine war; identity revealed
46.article_body: Ukrainian fighter pilot known as 'Ghost of Kyiv' has been killed in the war in the country, Mayor of Kolomyia, Bogdan Stanislavsky announced. After his death, the identity of the pilot was revealed as Major Stepan Tarabalka, 29. Tarabalka lost his life when the MiG-29 he was flying was shot down while battling "overwhelming" enemy forces, Stanislavsky said.

47.title: Theft of Pakistani music continues: Singer Hadiqa on Kanika's 'Boohey Barian' rendition
47.article_body: After singer Kanika Kapoor released her rendition of 'Boohey Barian', Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani took to Instagram and said, "Another day and another shameless rendition of the song my mother wrote." "I am alive and well, if you want [to] sing my songs, ask me first," she added. She further wrote, "The theft of Pakistani music continues."

48.title: Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time: Shubman Gill to Elon Musk
48.article_body: Addressing the world's richest person Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, cricketer Shubman Gill tweeted, "Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time. @elonmusk #swiggy." Reacting to his tweet, Swiggy Cares wrote, "Hi Shubman Gill. Twitter or no Twitter...we just want to make sure all is well with your orders (that is if you're ordering)."

49.title: Over $200 billion wiped off Amazon’s market value in its biggest 1-day drop since 2006
49.article_body: Amazon stock sank 14% in its biggest one-day drop since July 2006, with the shares closing on Friday at their lowest level since June 2020. With this, more than $200 billion was wiped off from the company's market valuation. This comes after the e-commerce giant reported quarterly loss for the first time in seven years.

50.title: Threads soaked in heroin worth ₹450 crore seized from Gujarat port; govt shares pic
50.article_body: Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence have recovered nearly 90 kilogram of heroin worth ₹450 crore from a shipping container that arrived at the Pipavav port in Amreli district from Iran. Threads were soaked in a solution containing heroin, which were then dried, made into bales and packed in bags for export, said Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia.

51.title: Delhi records second hottest April in 72 years: IMD
51.article_body: Delhi in 2022 recorded its second hottest April in 72 years, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Friday. The average maximum temperature during the month in the national capital stood at 40.2°C. Notably, Delhi on Thursday witnessed its warmest April day in 12 years amid heatwave, with the Safdarjung observatory recording a maximum temperature of 43.5°C, PTI reported.

52.title: It will spread a good message: AIMIM leader on inviting Raj Thackeray for Iftaar
52.article_body: AIMIM leader and Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel invited Raj Thackeray for an Iftaar party and said, "It will spread a good message in the country." "MNS chief Raj Thackeray is coming here for a rally on May 1. I invite him for Iftaar," he said. Jaleel further added that 99% of people are peace-loving, only 1% of people create disturbance.

53.title: Bengaluru records hottest day of the year on April 29 at 35.2°C
53.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed hottest day of the year on Friday (April 29) with city's maximum temperature touching 35.2°C. "This is not a heatwave as the temperature is just 1-2°C  above normal. For a heatwave, maximum temperature should be at least 4.5°C  above normal," IMD officials said. Bengaluru is expected to receive scattered rainfall in the coming days, IMD said.

54.title: Mobile internet services to be suspended from 9:30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today
54.article_body: Mobile internet services will be suspended from 9.30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today, according to an order by Principal Secretary, Home Affairs & Justice, Anurag Verma. This comes amid tensions after the violent clash between two groups in Patiala. Patiala Deputy Commissioner and SSP said that the data services could be grossly misused by certain unscrupulous elements.

55.title: If you don't speak Hindi leave this country and go: Sanjay Nishad
55.article_body: Responding to a media query about the ongoing language debate in the country, Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad said that Hindustan is not a place for people who don't speak Hindi. "They should leave this country and go somewhere else," he said. "If you do not love Hindi, it will be assumed that you are a foreigner," he added.

56.title: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation clears ₹1,417 crore budget
56.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation's executive committee cleared their proposed budget, which has an expenditure of ₹1,417 crore, for the 2022-23 financial year in a meeting on Friday. The total budget expenditure will be spent on various civic segments including cleaning, streetlights and water supply, and the effective expenditure for 2022-23 will be around ₹900 crore, GMC officials said.

57.title: Husband stabs wife at TN court ahead of divorce hearing; arrested
57.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly attempting to murder his wife by stabbing her multiple times outside a court in Tamil Nadu's Perambalur on Friday. The accused and his wife, who got married 19 years ago, had filed an appeal to get divorced and were appearing for the hearing. The wife was taken to a government hospital for treatment.

58.title: Delhi HC grants ₹15 lakh to victim 25 yrs after Connaught Place shooting
58.article_body: Delhi High Court granted compensation of ₹15 lakh to a victim who was injured in the 1997 Connaught Place shooting. The injury due to state action needs to be considered at a "higher standard" than ordinary cases of negligence, HC said. The victim and his two friends were travelling in a car when a shootout involving Delhi Police took place.

59.title: Hyderabad's Alair Police Station adjudged best in T'gana, 5th in country
59.article_body: The Alair Police Station under Hyderabad's Rachakonda Commissionerate has been adjudged the best police station in Telangana by the Union Ministry of Home Affairs. It also ranked fifth among the top 75 police stations in the country. "The Telangana Police force has been striving to provide impeccable services to...citizens round the clock," Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat said.

60.title: Swiggy to pilot use of drones for Instamart deliveries
60.article_body: Swiggy has said it will pilot the use of drones for its online grocery service, Instamart, starting May. The drones will be used to replenish stocks between seller-run dark stores and from a store to a common customer point. The orders will then be picked by delivery partners who will deliver them to the customers.

61.title: 28-year-old woman killed in a hit-and-run accident in Pune
61.article_body: A woman (28) was killed in a road accident at Dukkar Khind in Pune's Warje area on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Priyanka Ankush Mahajan, was riding a two-wheeler when she was hit by an unidentified vehicle which later fled the spot, police said. Notably, Mahajan was on her way to a job interview when the hit-and-run accident took place.

62.title: HC denies Labour Day procession request over traffic jams in B'luru
62.article_body: Karnataka High Court has denied a request by unions to hold a procession on the occasion of International Labour Day on May 1 in Bengaluru. The court said that a procession of 15,000 people on a Sunday during daytime would cause traffic congestion. The procession would have reportedly taken place from City Railway Station or Town Hall to Freedom Park.

63.title: Gold price dips as dollar climbs to 20-year high
63.article_body: Gold price extended loss for second successive week, logging biggest monthly drop in April since September 2021. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold rate for June contract closed at ₹51,760 per 10 gram mark on Friday. As per experts, the dip came as dollar index sustained above 100 for entire week leading to USD climbing to 20-year high levels.

64.title: Bombay HC allows 2 death row convicts to pursue studies in jail
64.article_body: The Bombay High Court allowed two convicts in the case of Kopardi rape and murder of minor to pursue their studies through open university while in prison. The HC bench said that the convicts' desire to pursue education was "welcome" and directed the prison authorities to "adopt a humanitarian approach", and "extend necessary assistance" to help them pursue their studies.

65.title: 2 policemen demand ₹5,000 bribe over bail request in Pune; booked
65.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau has booked two police officers for allegedly demanding ₹5,000 as a bribe from a woman who was helping her colleague get bail. The accused were identified as sub-inspector Suresh Pundalik Gite and havaldar Santosh Sathe and are from the Shirur police station. The woman's colleague is booked in a criminal case.

66.title: Lemonade seller beaten to death after he uses 'stale' lemons in Ghaziabad
66.article_body: A lemonade seller was beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad over payment issues following which an e-rickshaw driver was arrested, police said. The victim used stale lemons, the accused claimed. A scuffle broke out between the accused, who was with two other persons, and the victim. The lemonade seller was beaten with sticks and stones, his family alleged.

67.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy features on cover of TIME magazine
67.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has featured on the cover of TIME magazine amid the war in his country. The text on the magazine's cover reads, "How Zelenskyy leads: Inside the compound with the President and his team." "People see this war on Instagram, on social media. When they get sick of it, they will scroll away," he said.

68.title: Haryana CM meets Union Power Minister, discusses power supply issue
68.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Union Power Minister RK Singh met and it was agreed that 300 MW from the Kameng Hydro Electric project will be supplied to Haryana. "Haryana has decided to set up a new unit of 750 MW at its Yamuna Nagar plant for which the Ministry of Power will extend...assistance," the ministry's statement said.

69.title: Urge people to not be provoked: Captain Amarinder on Patiala clash
69.article_body: Expressing concerns over the situation in Punjab's Patiala, former CM Captain Amarinder Singh urged people to not get provoked. "People of Patiala are peace-loving...Hope that Punjab Police will take firm action and ensure that law and order are maintained," Captain tweeted. Tension prevailed after Shiv Sena members and pro-Khalistani activists clashed.

70.title: Punjab CM never met me over coal crisis: Union Coal Minister
70.article_body: Reacting to a comment made by AAP MP Raghav Chadha, Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that AAP "has a habit of lying." He added that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann "never met" him to discuss the coal crisis. "They have never met me and they're saying that they have. [They are] taking my name and spreading lies," Joshi said.

71.title: Probe 23-yr-old basketball player's death: Kerala CM to Bihar CM
71.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday wrote a letter to his Bihar counterpart Nitish Kumar seeking "a comprehensive and fair investigation" into the alleged suicide of Lithara. She was a 23-year-old basketball player from Kerala employed in Indian Railways in Patna. The victim's family alleged she was being mentally harassed by her coach and she'd complained to them about it.

72.title: Bihar Police to use AI to nab gangs involved in banned liquor trade
72.article_body: Bihar Police is planning to introduce Artificial intelligence (AI) technology to help officers catch gangs or individuals involved in the banned liquor trade. The AI mechanism will make it "easy to identify...area of operations with real-time analytics and automated processes," police said. The Bihar Prohibition Act, imposed in 2016, bans the manufacture, sale and consumption of liquor.

73.title: LSG defeat PBKS to register their 6th win in IPL 2022, move to 3rd on the points table
73.article_body: LSG defeated PBKS by 20 runs to register their sixth win in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the third position on the points table. PBKS have now lost five matches in the season. Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG in the match with 46(37), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan took three wickets.

74.title: EU border agency chief resigns amid accusations of rights abuse
74.article_body: The head of the European Union's border agency, Frontex, has resigned amid criticism of the treatment of migrants at the borders. Fabrice Leggeri is accused of tolerating illegal "pushbacks" of migrants, which violate the EU's obligations under international humanitarian law that prohibits returning people to where their lives would be at risk. Leggeri had dismissed the accusations in the past.

75.title: Seized heroin appeared in Flipkart packaging: CAIT as it seeks probe against firm
75.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has sought an NCB investigation against Flipkart over its alleged role in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh drug racket busted by the NCB. "The seized heroin and other articles appeared in Flipkart packaging as per video and photos available on media," the CAIT said. "Flipkart's possible involvement in illegal activities...must not go unnoticed," it added.

76.title: Arshdeep should get a chance to play for India vs SA in T20Is: Sehwag
76.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh should be given a chance to play for India in their home T20I series against South Africa in June. "You'll know how he bowls against an international team...he'll get some experience too," he added. Arshdeep, who has taken three wickets so far, has an economy rate of 5.66 at death overs.

77.title: BJP did corruption in J'khand: Congress leader on power crisis
77.article_body: Blaming BJP for the ongoing power crisis in Jharkhand, Congress spokesperson Rakesh Sinha accused the BJP of corruption. "But what have they (BJP) done in these years? They have given nothing in the name of infrastructure to the state," he said. "They kept indulging in corrupt activities instead of providing infrastructure to the state", Sinha added.

78.title: US unlikely to eliminate coronavirus: Anthony Fauci
78.article_body: The coronavirus pandemic is not over and it is unlikely that the US will ever eliminate COVID-19, according to US President Joe Biden's Chief Medical Advisor Anthony Fauci. "By no means is it over. We still are experiencing a global pandemic," he said. Health officials are hoping to reach a point where COVID-19 can be controlled, he added.

79.title: Talks of BJP-MNS alliance are false: Devendra Fadnavis
79.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis dismissed reports of BJP's alliance with Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS). Fadnavis said there was no such proposal. "Yes, Raj Thackeray took issues of loudspeakers...that has been our issue...but alliance talks are false," he said. MNS's Yashwant Killedar also denied reports of an alliance between BJP and MNS.

80.title: 2 men robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint in Punjab's Ludhiana
80.article_body: Two employees of a private firm were robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint on Bhaini Gujra Link road in Ludhiana, Punjab. Ram Singh, who hails from Rajasthan, said that the miscreants injured the duo with sharp-edged weapons and threatened them at gunpoint. The police are scanning the footage of CCTV cameras installed to identify the culprits, sub-inspector Dalwinder Singh said.

81.title: India's peak power demand reaches all-time high of 207 GW amid heatwave
81.article_body: Amid a heatwave in India, the country's energy demand reached an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW (207 GW) at 02.50 pm on Friday, the Power Ministry said. This came after the peak power demand had reached a record 204.65 GW on Thursday. The peak power shortage recorded on Thursday was 10.77 GW.

82.title: It'd be a mistake to imagine Stokes as long-term Eng Test skipper: Atherton
82.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Atherton has said it would be a "mistake" to imagine Ben Stokes as a "long-term" choice for England Test skipper's role. "Having seen the way the job wears down even the toughest and flintiest of characters, there is no need for the same to happen to Stokes," he added. Stokes was appointed as Test captain on Thursday.

83.title: Cong leader meets Azam Khan's family, says 'SP didn’t stand with him'
83.article_body: Congress leader Pramod Krishnam on Thursday met jailed Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan’s family in UP's Rampur and said that SP didn't perform its duty to stand with him. He further urged BJP to reconsider its decisions citing Khan's ill health and said, "We're standing with him and his family. It should be seen from...perspective of humanity and not politics."

84.title: War showed Zelenskyy's true qualities to world: Ukraine Prez's wife
84.article_body: In an interview published on Friday, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska said that the war has revealed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's true qualities to the world. "He has always been a man you can rely on. A man who'll never fail. Who'll hold out until the end," she added. Zelenska revealed she hasn't seen her husband since the conflict began.

85.title: Man shot at while trying to flee from police custody in Assam
85.article_body: A man in Assam's Cachar district, who was recently arrested for robbery, was shot at by police after he allegedly tried to escape. He sustained a bullet injury in his leg and has been admitted to hospital. The incident reportedly took place in Auliyatilla near Silchar town where he had been escorted by police in order to recover stolen motorcycles.

86.title: Who cares how much somebody spends on a house: Sunny on reports of buying ₹16cr house
86.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone, while reacting to reports of spending ₹16 crore on a three-bedroom penthouse in Mumbai, said, "I think it's the media's job to verify and figure out what needs to be put out. Who cares how much somebody spends on a house?" "People sometimes make s**t up just for the heck of it," she added.

87.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes 3rd hundred in 3 county matches
87.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Friday smashed his third hundred in three matches for Sussex in the County Championship Division Two. Pujara is unbeaten on 128 off 198 deliveries after stumps on Day 2 of Sussex's match against Durham. Earlier in the season, Pujara had scored 109 runs against Worcestershire and 201* against Derbyshire.

88.title: First solar eclipse of 2022 to take place on April 30, NASA reveals locations
88.article_body: On April 30, people in some locations will have a chance to witness the first solar eclipse of the year. As it sets, the Sun will appear partially eclipsed in Chile, Argentina, most of Uruguay, western Paraguay, southwestern Bolivia, southeastern Peru and a small area of southwestern Brazil. It'll also be visible along parts of the northwestern coastline of Antarctica.

89.title: World's longest glass-bottomed bridge opens in Vietnam, pics surface
89.article_body: A 632-metre-long glass-bottomed bridge suspended 150 metres (490 feet) above a jungle has opened in Vietnam. The Bach Long ('White Dragon') pedestrian bridge is believed to be the world's longest glass-bottomed bridge and is located in Vietnam's northwest Son La province. Its floor is made from French-manufactured tempered glass, making it strong enough to support 450 people at a time.

90.title: There's nothing agricultural about Rahul's batting in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
90.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul's batting form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the LSG captain has been outstanding. "The best part about Rahul's batting is that nothing is agricultural in his cricketing shots. Every shot that he plays is a proper textbook stroke," he added. With 374 runs from nine matches, Rahul is second-highest run-scorer so far.

91.title: Millions of honeybees die after being left on hot tarmac at US airport
91.article_body: Millions of bees that were set to be shipped to beekeepers across US' Alaska have died after they were left on a hot tarmac in Atlanta. Beekeepers who were waiting for the shipment called it "devastating". A beekeeper waiting for the shipment said that bees had escaped from their crates in the plane, so Delta Airlines had put them outside.

92.title: Elon Musk has lined up a new CEO for Twitter: Report
92.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, has lined up a new CEO for the company, Reuters reported. Musk earlier told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor that he doesn't have confidence in Twitter's management. Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal will reportedly receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

93.title: Ex-US Marine killed fighting alongside Ukrainian forces in Ukraine
93.article_body: Former US Marine Willy Joseph Cancel was killed alongside Ukrainian forces this week, his relatives said, in the first known death of an American fighting in Ukraine. "He wanted to go over because he believed in what Ukraine was fighting for," Rebecca Cabrera, Cancel's mother, said. The US has warned Americans against going to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

94.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Bhutanese counterpart, hands over medical supplies
94.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday met his Bhutanese counterpart Tandi Dorji and handed over medical supplies to him. Jaishankar said, "It's my honour to hand over the 12th consignment of medical supplies to Bhutan, as a gift from the government and people of India to...Bhutan." "We'll continue to stand...by your side through...post-COVID-19 sustainable recovery," he added.

95.title: 2 Chennai auto drivers fined ₹6,100 after abusing woman over fare
95.article_body: Two auto drivers in TN's Chennai, who reportedly abused a woman and her son and threw out their luggage after an argument over fare on Wednesday, have been fined a total of ₹6,100 by police. A passerby had shared a video of the incident on social media following which the city Commissioner directed officers to take action, an officer said.

96.title: 25 swords seized from auto in Maharashtra's Nanded, 2 arrested
96.article_body: Police in Maharashtra's Nanded on Friday recovered 25 swords that were being transported in an autorickshaw. Police had intercepted the auto after receiving information about two persons carrying a consignment of weapons. A boy and the owner of a gift shop were arrested and an investigation is underway. Earlier, police recovered 89 swords and a dagger in Dhule.

97.title: Wipro plans to hire 38,000 freshers in FY23
97.article_body: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company hired over 19,000 freshers in FY22 and expects to double the number in FY23. Wipro added 45,416 employees on a year-on-year basis during the financial year, taking its total headcount to 2,43,128. The company said it plans to increase the frequency of promotion cycle for 70% employees in junior bands to quarterly basis.

98.title: He couldn't even become UP CM: Mayawati on Akhilesh's 'PM' remark
98.article_body: After Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he wanted BSP chief Mayawati to be PM, the latter reacted by saying, "They need to stop making such childish statements." She tweeted, "When (Akhilesh) couldn't fulfil his own dream of becoming (UP CM) even after securing...votes of Muslims and Yadavs...how would he manage to meet someone else's aspiration to become PM."

99.title: Sri Lankan Prez agreed to remove brother as PM: Ex-Prez Sirisena
99.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to remove his older brother Mahinda Rajapaksa as the PM in a proposed interim government to solve a political impasse, ex-President Maithripala Sirisena said on Friday. The impasse was caused by the country's worst economic crisis in decades. The interim government will include all the parties in the Parliament, Sirisena added.

100.title: Bulldozers & swords given to people in name of religion: Mufti
100.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Friday said that people have been 'given bulldozers and swords in the name of religion'. She added that the situation was similar to a neighbouring country which "gave guns to people in name of religion". She further alleged that the Centre was 'pitting Hindus and Muslims against each other to hide job crisis and inflation'.

101.title: Will not do mankad unless the guy is properly cheating: LSG's Stoinis
101.article_body: On being asked if he would 'mankad' the batter, LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he won't do it unless the player is "properly cheating" at the non-strikers end. He added, "I'd probably tell him off first and ask him to stay in the crease." Stoinis has scored 73 runs and taken one wicket in five IPL 2022 matches so far.

102.title: Owaisi breaks down during speech, says 'Muslims are being wiped out'
102.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday broke down while addressing a gathering in Hyderabad and alleged that "Muslims are being wiped out of the country". Speaking on the bulldozer row, Owaisi said that he gets calls every day about the "instances of injustice" happening in India. "One shouldn't lose hope...We'll face it with patience but will never raze...home," he added.

103.title: Statehood demand for North Bengal justified: BJP MLA amid heatwave
103.article_body: Condemning West Bengal government's decision to announce early summer vacations in schools due to heatwave, BJP MLA Sankar Ghosh said the demand for separate statehood for North Bengal was "justified". He called North Bengal's weather "moderately pleasant". The "step-motherly" treatment of the TMC government towards North Bengal has led to this demand, he added.

104.title: Curfew imposed in Punjab's Patiala till 6 am tomorrow after 2 groups clash
104.article_body: Local authorities have imposed an 11-hour curfew in Punjab's Patiala after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena on Friday. The curfew, which was imposed from 7 pm, will remain in force till 6 am on Saturday. According to Patiala SSP, four persons, including two police personnel, have sustained injuries in the incident.

105.title: India's economy may take up to 13 years to recover from COVID-19 losses: RBI
105.article_body: India is expected to overcome the losses caused by the COVID-19 disruptions by 2034-35, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated in its report on currency and financing released on Friday. It further stated, "India suffered among the biggest pandemic induced losses in the world in terms of output, lives and livelihoods...Economic activity has barely recovered...even after two years."

106.title: Nobody else is bowling at 150 kmph in world right now: Steyn on SRH's Umran
106.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said the franchise's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik will undoubtedly play for Team India in future as he's bowling at 150 kmph consistently in IPL 2022. "Nobody else is doing that in the world right now," he added. "I'm just trying to pat him on the shoulder and...encourage him when he bowls well," he further said.

107.title: Pregnant woman forced to drink toilet cleaner by husband in Telangana, dies
107.article_body: A pregnant woman in Telangana's Nizamabad district died on Wednesday after her husband forced her to drink toilet cleaner. The accused is on the run and police have formed teams to catch him. The woman's family members lodged a complaint against the accused and his family members alleging that they had harassed her for additional dowry.

108.title: MP-MLA couple's intent was to challenge law and order: Mumbai Police
108.article_body: Mumbai Police today opposed the bail pleas of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana. Police claimed the couple's announcement to recite Hanuman Chalisa in front of CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence was with an intention to challenge law and order. Their acts were part of the larger conspiracy to get Maha Vikas Aghadi government dissolved, police added.

109.title: 182 COVID-19 cases reported at IIT Madras campus so far as 11 more test +ve
109.article_body: Eleven more persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of infected people to 182, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan informed on Friday. Radhakrishnan added that the campus hasn't been closed yet and government and campus authorities are trying to ensure that the COVID-19 cluster does not spread to other places.

110.title: 50 killed in a blast after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan
110.article_body: An explosion killed more than 50 worshippers after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan's Kabul, the head of the mosque said. The attack came as worshippers at the Sunni mosque gathered after Friday prayers for a congregation. Several mosques and cities are being targeted in Afghanistan during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

111.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal activists recite Hanuman Chalisa in support of temple in Agra
111.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal activists on Friday recited the Hanuman Chalisa at the office of the Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) of North Central Railway's Agra division in Uttar Pradesh. As per reports, the activists were opposing any move to shift the Chamunda Devi temple from the platform of the Raja Ki Mandi railway station in the city.

112.title: Hindi is a link language: K'taka minister on nat'l language debate
112.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's exchange over the national language, Karnataka minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan said, "Hindi is nothing but a link language." He said, "We need to love our language and at the same time, respect other languages and coexist." We are here to promote the local language as it is our identity, he added.

113.title: Putin, Zelenskyy accept Indonesia's invites to attend G20 summit
113.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy have accepted Indonesia's invites to G20 summit in November, amid calls by US and its allies to remove Russia from the grouping. Indonesia, the current chair of the G20, said that the war in Ukraine has impacted the recovery of the global economy. Notably, Ukraine is not a G20 member.

114.title: I’m not a major fan of it in all honesty: Russell on F1 sprint races
114.article_body: Mercedes' George Russell said he is "not a major fan" of F1 sprint races after the first sprint race of the season at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. There are three sprint races scheduled for this season, with a push by several teams to double that to six sprint races. Russell added sprint races should "probably be 50% longer".

115.title: BJP wants to create disturbance over louspeaker issue: Sanjay Raut
115.article_body:
Accusing the BJP of creating disturbance over the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra,
Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the BJP opposed an all-party meet called by the state government to discuss the issue. "[This] means you (BJP) want to do politics and want to create a disturbance on the matter of loudspeakers in [Maharashtra]," Sanjay Raut said.

116.title: Man Utd interim boss Rangnick appointed as Austria head coach
116.article_body: Manchester United on Friday said interim boss Ralf Rangnick has been appointed as the head coach of the Austrian national football team. United said Rangnick will join the national team at the end of May after the 2021-22 Premier League season ends. The club added Rangnick, 63, "will combine the job with his consultancy role at Old Trafford as planned."

117.title: Thousands take part in anti-Israel rallies on Jerusalem Day in Iran
117.article_body: Thousands of Iranians on Friday took part in rallies in Iran to mark the "Quds Day" (Jerusalem Day) for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began. The day, being marked since 1979, is a way of showing support for the Palestinians. The demonstrators chanted "Death to Israel" and "Death to America" at the rally.

118.title: I think it should be Sanskrit: Kangana Ranaut on national language debate
118.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while speaking on the national language debate, said, "If you ask me which language should be the national language, then I think it should be Sanskrit." "Sanskrit is older than Kannada, Tamil, Gujarati or Hindi. All these languages have come from Sanskrit. Then why hasn't Sanskrit become the national language?" she added.

119.title: 56-yr-old Odisha MLA appears for Class 10 board exam, says 'it was my wish'
119.article_body: BJD MLA from Odisha's Phulbani, Angada Kanhar, appeared for his Class 10 state board examination on Friday, at the age of 56. "I couldn't appear for the examination when I had to, due to various family issues...It was my wish to appear for the examination," he said. Kanhar appeared for the examination at a school along with 67 other students.

120.title: Ex-Tennis champion Boris Becker jailed for 2.5yrs for hiding assets after bankruptcy in UK
120.article_body: Former Wimbledon champion Boris Becker has been jailed for 2.5 years in the UK for hiding £2.5 million worth of assets and loans to avoid paying debts after being made bankrupt in June 2017. The 54-year-old was found guilty of four charges under the Insolvency Act and was cleared on 20 counts, the UK media reported.

121.title: Zerodha CEO's fake Insta ID used to scam user, he shares screenshot
121.article_body: Zerodha CEO and co-founder Nithin Kamath recently warned people of various types of frauds he has encountered and used his fake account as an example. He shared a screenshot of the fake Instagram page trying to scam a user with a "crypto scheme" promising to generate $10,000 in a week. "Phishing frauds' [number] has gone through the roof," he said.

122.title: Sakariya executed his plan perfectly to dismiss Finch: DC bowling coach
122.article_body: Praising Chetan Sakariya, who made his debut for DC against KKR in IPL 2022, DC bowling coach James Hopes said the pacer didn't miss a beat and executed his plan to perfection to dismiss Aaron Finch. The KKR opener was clean bowled in Sakariya's first over of the match after scoring a seven-ball three. He posted bowling figures of 3-0-17-1.

123.title: It doesn’t make sense: Belarus’ Victoria Azarenka on Wimbledon ban
123.article_body: Belarus' Victoria Azarenka said Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from participating "doesn't make sense". The All England Lawn Tennis Club made the decision following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, which has been termed as "discriminatory" by the ATP and the WTA. "I think there should be a reaction to that, that's all I want to say," Azarenka said.

124.title: US arrests British Virgin Islands Premier on drug trafficking charges
124.article_body: The US has arrested British Virgin Islands (BVI) Premier Andrew Fahie on charges related to drug trafficking and money laundering. Fahie agreed to allow a trafficker, an undercover agent, to use BVI ports to ship cocaine to the US in return for money, a statement said. BVI Governor John Rankin said, "I realise this will be shocking news for people."

125.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
125.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that recorded more than 44°C as their maximum temperature on Friday. UP's Banda with 47.4°C recorded the highest maximum temperature, followed by 46.8°C in Prayagraj. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded maximum temperature of 46.4°C, while UP's Jhansi and Delhi's Sports Complex observatory recorded 46.2°C maximum temperature.

126.title: Man climbs atop mobile tower in Punjab, demands release of Sikh prisoners
126.article_body: A Sikh man climbed atop a mobile tower in Rode village of Punjab's Moga district on Friday, demanding justice for Sikhs across the country. His demands included the release of Sikh prisoners from jails across the country, justice in cases of sacrilege of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib and shifting of Khalistani extremist Jagtar Singh Hawara from Delhi's Tihar jail.

127.title: Make sure to conserve maximum energy: Du Plessis on playing in heat in IPL
127.article_body: Speaking about playing amid heat wave in Maharashtra in ongoing IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said he takes lots of fluids before the match, adding it's important to manage the intensity while practising. He added that one has to make sure to conserve maximum energy in hot conditions. RCB will face GT in an afternoon match on Saturday.

128.title: $170 billion wiped off Amazon's market value in its biggest drop since 2014
128.article_body: Shares of Amazon fell as much as 12% on Friday in its biggest intraday percentage drop since July 2014, wiping off about $170 billion from the company's market valuation. The company's shares declined after it reported a loss of $3.8 billion for Q1 2022, marking its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon also posted the slowest sales growth since 2001.

129.title: Won't let anyone create disturbance in Punjab: CM Mann on Patiala clashes
129.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday termed the incident of clashes in Patiala as "deeply unfortunate". CM Mann said, "We're closely monitoring the situation and will not let anyone create disturbance in the [state]. Punjab's peace and harmony [are] of utmost importance." Reportedly, stones were hurled and swords were brandished after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala today.

130.title: SII's Covovax approved for COVID-19 vaccination of kids aged 12-17: Reports
130.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax COVID-19 vaccine has been recommended for vaccination of children in the 12-17 years age group by NTAGI, multiple reports said on Friday. The vaccine was granted approval for restricted emergency use among adults on December 28, 2021 and among children aged 12-17 years, on March 9. SII had requested its inclusion in the vaccination drive.

131.title: Man arrested with foreign currency worth ₹59 lakh at Delhi's IGI Airport
131.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Friday seized foreign currency worth approximately ₹59 lakh from a passenger at Delhi's IGI Airport. Officials said $22,000 and 2,00,000 UAE Dirham were found concealed under the false bottom of the bag of the passenger, who was stopped based on suspicion. The man was kept under close watch through physical and electronic measures.

132.title: Trump posts for the 1st time on his Truth Social app, uses viral typo #COVFEFE
132.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump posted for the first time on his Truth Social app, months after its launch and wrote, "I'M BACK! #COVFEFE." The term referred to a typing error he made in his tweet about the press while he was the President. Trump was banned from Twitter in January last year after Capitol riots.

133.title: Change has come but for the worse: Nawazuddin amid KGF 2, RRR's success
133.article_body: Amid the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2' and 'RRR', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told NDTV that after over two years of delayed films and locked theatres, his hope was that audience would emerge from the pandemic with a refined taste for cinema. "I felt the audience would mature after the pandemic...Change has come but it's for the worse," he stated.

134.title: Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for me: Snapdeal CEO
134.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said that Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for him. "Whether it's Infosys, Aadhaar, UPI and now ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce), his impact on India and its global standing is nothing short of incredible," Bahl tweeted. While Nilekani's personality is distinct compared to Musk's, the quantum of his impact isn't, he added.

135.title: Sindhu reaches Badminton Asia Championships semis, confirms a medal
135.article_body: World number seven PV Sindhu assured herself of a medal at 2022 Badminton Asia Championships after entering semi-finals in Manila on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu beat China's He Bing Jiao 21-9, 13-21, 21-19 in the quarter-final. Notably, Sindhu had won a bronze at the 2014 edition in Gimcheon. The 26-year-old Indian will face defending champion Japan's Akane Yamaguchi on Saturday.

136.title: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora involved in minor road accident
136.article_body: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, his associate Rachita Berry and franchise mentor Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora were involved in a minor road accident today, the franchise said in a statement. The accident occurred when they were en route to the MCA Stadium in Pune for LSG's match against PBKS. "Fortunately, all three are safe and well," the franchise further stated.

137.title: Musk said he'll cut jobs at Twitter while securing bank loans for buyout: Reports
137.article_body: Elon Musk told banks he will crackdown on the salaries of Twitter executives and board members and develop new ways to monetise tweets, Reuters reported, quoting people familiar with the matter. Musk specifically mentioned job cuts as a part of his pitch to the banks to secure debt for the buyout, reports said. He took Twitter private for $44 billion.

138.title: PBKS to bowl first against LSG, Avesh Khan replaces Manish Pandey
138.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. PBKS are fielding an unchanged playing XI, while LSG have replaced Manish Pandey with Avesh Khan. LSG are currently placed fourth on the points table, while PBKS are seventh.

139.title: Cybercriminals using Collector's photo as WhatsApp DPs: Hyd Police
139.article_body: Hyderabad Police put out an alert on Twitter asking users to stay alert as cybercriminals have been using District Collector's photo as their WhatsApp display pictures to cheat people. "Cybercriminals... (are) sending messages for financial help. Beware," Hyderabad City Police tweeted. "Do not believe such messages and do not be cheated", the police added.

140.title: Shiv Sena suspends Harish Singla after clashes during rally in Patiala
140.article_body: Shiv Sena has suspended the working president of its Punjab unit, Harish Singla, for "anti-party activities", according to an official letter issued by the party today. This comes after clashes broke out between two groups during Shiv Sena's anti-Khalistan rally in Patiala. The rally was being led by Singla and was reportedly held without a "go ahead" from the party.

141.title: Mumbai AC local trains' ticket prices cut by 50%, 5 km-journey to cost ₹30
141.article_body: Union Minister of State for Railways, Raosaheb Patil Danve, on Friday announced a 50% reduction in the ticket prices of air-conditioned local trains in Mumbai. According to him, the existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of five kilometres will be reduced to ₹30. Danve further said that the fare reduction was a long-pending demand of the public.

142.title: RR to wear special jersey tomorrow to honour Shane Warne, share pics
142.article_body: RR will wear a special jersey in their IPL 2022 match against MI at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai tomorrow to honour late Australian spin legend Shane Warne. The players will sport initials 'SW23' on the leading collar of their shirts as a tribute to Warne. RR had won the inaugural season of IPL in 2008 under Warne's captaincy.

143.title: We're very excited that Nadal is here: Madrid Masters director Lopez
143.article_body: Madrid Masters tournament director Feliciano Lopez said everyone is excited about five-time champion Rafael Nadal playing in the tournament, beginning Sunday. "I have hopes that we can see him 100% on Wednesday," he added. The 35-year-old, who is 20-1 this season, hasn't played since losing in Indian Wells Masters final last month. He had injured his rib in semi-finals.

144.title: N Korea halts freight train services with China over COVID outbreak
144.article_body: The freight train services between China and North Korea have been suspended in response to a COVID-19 outbreak in the Chinese border city of Dandong. Local authorities have locked down 77 residential compounds in response to the outbreak that began in late April. The move comes within four months of North Korea easing the border lockdown enforced in 2020.

145.title: 22-yr-old jumps from 1st floor of Punjab showroom as 18-yr-old man tries to rape her
145.article_body: A 22-year-old woman sustained several injuries after she jumped from the first floor of a showroom in Punjab's Jamalpur allegedly after an 18-year-old man tried to rape her. "The accused found the woman alone at the shop and barged inside on the pretext of porting his mobile number," police said. The accused has been arrested.

146.title: Fuel price hike lowest under PM Modi's regime: Union minister Hardeep Puri
146.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said fuel price hike under the PM Narendra Modi-led government had been the lowest. "Basic salaries have increased over decades...The government is giving free schemes to people under various categories," he added. "The PM has advocated for the best spirit of cooperative federalism pertaining to the issue of livelihoods," the minister said.

147.title: PM Modi wears turban as he hosts Sikh delegation at his residence, pic surfaces
147.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hosted a Sikh delegation and addressed them at his residence in Delhi. Visuals from the event showed PM Modi sporting a turban as he greeted the delegation. "Going to Gurudwaras, spending time in service, getting langar, staying at the homes of Sikh families have been a part of my life," he said.

148.title: Tamil Nadu passes resolution urging Centre to allow it to send aid to Sri Lanka
148.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly on Friday unanimously passed a resolution urging the Centre to permit the state government to send essential commodities, including rice, pulses, dairy products and medicines, to Sri Lanka, amid the ongoing economic crisis. "We can't see the development in Sri Lanka as the neighbouring country's internal issue...Help should be prompt, on time," CM MK Stalin said.

149.title: MP hospital lift with patient, 6 others gets stuck for an hour
149.article_body: Seven persons, including an elderly patient on oxygen, were allegedly stuck for an hour in the lift of Shalby Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday. "We boarded the lift from...ninth floor and it got stuck on...tenth floor," a visitor said, adding, that the patient faced breathing difficulties. The hospital however claimed that the lift was opened in five minutes.

150.title: I-T official dies after SUV crashes head-on with her scooter in MP
150.article_body: A 59-year-old income tax official died after an SUV collided with her scooter head-on in MP's Bhopal on Thursday, police said. The victim, Sunita Chouhan, sustained severe head injuries after the crash and died in hospital during treatment. Police have obtained a picture of the car and are currently looking for the driver who fled after the accident.

151.title: He said 'just 1 kiss?': Another woman accuses Vijay Babu of sexual misconduct
151.article_body: After an actress accused Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, another woman has come forward to accuse him of behaving inappropriately with her in 2021. "[Vijay and I] met for a work-related thing...Suddenly he leaned to kiss me on my lips...without any consent," she alleged. "I pulled myself backwards...he then asked me 'Just one kiss?' I...said no," she added.

152.title: 18,000 kg of chicken nuggets from overturned truck closes US highway; pic surfaces
152.article_body: A highway in the US was closed for several hours this week after a tractor-trailer overturned and spilled chicken nuggets onto the road. Police say the tractor-trailer was carrying 40,000 pounds (over 18,000 kg) of frozen nuggets when the driver lost control. The driver was not injured. Crews remained on the scene for hours to clean up the chicken.

153.title: Gadkari inaugurates 12 National Highway projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Hyd
153.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated 12 National Highway (NH) projects worth ₹8,000 crore and seven Central Road Infrastructure Fund (CRIF) projects in Hyderabad. The NH projects, with a combined length of 460 km, will boost inter-state connectivity by enabling seamless travel from Telangana to Maharashtra, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

154.title: Shah Faesal will serve same govt that imprisoned him: Omar Abdullah
154.article_body: Former J&K CM and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Friday congratulated former IAS officer Shah Faesal on his return to the government service. He, however, added that Faesal will now be serving the same government that imprisoned him. Faesal, who had quit the government service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, was detained after Article 370 was abrogated.

155.title: Bengaluru police arrest 4 drug peddlers, seize ganja worth ₹1.5 lakh
155.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested four Kerala-based drug peddlers, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police have recovered 2 kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹1.5 lakh, from their possession. Further, police have also recovered four mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from their possession.

156.title: Russian submarine strikes Ukrainian targets with cruise missiles
156.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that a Russian submarine in the Black Sea carried out missile strikes against Ukrainian military targets. The ministry also released a video of Kalibr cruise missiles being launched from the sea. Notably, this is the first time Russia has announced the use of its submarine fleet to hit Ukrainian targets, according to reports.

157.title: Lt General BS Raju appointed as new Vice Chief of Army Staff
157.article_body: Lieutenant General BS Raju has been appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff. Lt General Raju is currently serving as the Director-General of Military Operations. The appointment is reportedly a rare instance of an officer who's not been an Army Commander, getting appointed as the Vice Chief. He will take charge on May 1.

158.title: I don't like watching my films as I feel I could've done better: Ajay Devgn
158.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he doesn't like watching his films after a few months of release as he feels he could have done better. The actor, who recently appeared in 'RRR' and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said he hasn't watched either of the films. "I feel like I must have done terrible work and I don't want to watch it," Ajay added.

159.title: Papa said 'you'll find mother dead when you return': Daughters on UP BJP leader's death
159.article_body: After BJP leader Shweta Singh Gaur's dead body was found in her room in Uttar Pradesh's Banda, her daughters accused their father Deepak Singh Gaur, grandfather and other family members of murder. "Papa said that when you come back from school, you will find your mother dead...He wanted a son...They killed my mother," the daughters said.

160.title: Benedict Cumberbatch to host Ukrainian family who fled amid Russian invasion
160.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, in an interview with Sky News, confirmed that he's welcoming a Ukrainian family, who fled amid the Russian invasion, to his UK home. "I want to give them some stability after the turmoil that they've experienced...that's within my home," Cumberbatch said. The actor also revealed that he is helping other refugees by covering their housing costs in UK.

161.title: Australia squad for Sri Lanka series announced, Cummins rested for T20Is
161.article_body: Test captain Pat Cummins has been rested from the T20I squad from Australia's all-format tour of Sri Lanka in June and July. Marcus Harris, opener in four out of five Tests in Ashes series, was dropped from the Test squad. Spinner Adam Zampa will miss the tour as he's awaiting fatherhood. Tour comprises three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

162.title: World no. 7 Ruud beats Molcan to reach BMW Open quarter-finals
162.article_body: World number seven Casper Ruud on Thursday beat Alex Molcan 3-6, 6-4, 6-4 to reach the quarter-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "It was a very tough test. I didn't get off to a great start," Ruud said. "It gives me confidence I am able to win matches like these," he added. Ruud, 23, reached the semi-finals last year.

163.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores to help Man Utd draw 1-1 with Chelsea in PL
163.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored to help Manchester United draw 1-1 with Chelsea in the Premier League on Thursday. Ronaldo scored in the 62nd minute after Marcos Alonso gave Chelsea the lead in the 60th minute. Chelsea are currently third on the Premier League table with 66 points in 33 games. Chelsea will face Everton next in the Premier League on Sunday.

164.title: China to allow 'some' Indian students' return after India suspends Chinese visas
164.article_body: China will permit some Indian students to return for their studies, over two years after visa and flight restrictions were imposed due to COVID-19, the country's Foreign Ministry has said. "China attaches high importance to Indian students' concerns about returning," it added. This came after India suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas, following its refusal to let Indian students return.

165.title: 64 villagers booked for killing leopard, attacking public servants in UP
165.article_body: As many as 64 people, including 10 women, were booked in connection with the killing of a three-year-old leopard by villagers in Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, police said. The incident took place after the leopard allegedly injured 13 villagers inside the sanctuary. The accused also allegedly attacked public servants and obstructed government work, the DFO said.

166.title: Pankaj remembers Irrfan on death anniversary, says 'I've only watched his films'
166.article_body: Remembering Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary, Pankaj Tripathi said, "I get emotional every time I'm asked to talk about him." "Be it for craft, intellect, on-screen and off-screen behaviour, how to view acting, he has inspired everyone immensely," he said, adding, "When he acted, it made us take note of how he did it...I've only watched Irrfan's films."

167.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence sent to 2-day police custody
167.article_body: A Delhi court has sent Fareed alias Neetu, one of the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, to two-day police custody. Delhi Police Crime Branch had arrested 31-year-old Fareed from West Bengal. Police have alleged that he's "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community" during the clashes that erupted during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri.

168.title: Assam court grants bail to Guj MLA Mevani in policewoman assault case
168.article_body: An Assam court has granted bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman. "He is likely to be released...[on Saturday]," Mevani's legal counsel Angshuman Bora said. Notably, Mevani was re-arrested in the assault case on Monday just after being granted bail in another case related to alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

169.title: Shahid, Ishaan could've turned losers after my failed marriages: Mom Neliima
169.article_body: Neliima Azeem, mother of Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, said, "My sons...[faced] a lot of challenges because, unfortunately, both my marriages failed." "I was extremely busy with (work)...I was bread earner...There were ups and downs," she said, adding, "My children shone through it all. For that, I give them an extra badge, because they...could've been losers also because of it."

170.title: If Umran remains hell bent on not reducing his pace, it won't work: Munaf
170.article_body: Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said it "won't work" if SRH pacer Umran Malik remains "hell bent" on not reducing his pace at any cost. "You have to bowl in our conditions which are not ideal for fast bowling," added Munaf. "If he can focus more on line and length like Dale Steyn...then no one can stop him," stated Munaf.

171.title: Sidhu lauds Punjab govt as it frees 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali
171.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded the Punjab government for freeing 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali. The land had been encroached on since 2007, the Department of Rural Development and Panchayats said. "My accolades to Panchayat Minister Kuldeep Dhaliwal...This is the way forward for Punjab...seize properties of...illegal...occupants, no matter who they are," Sidhu tweeted.

172.title: Pune's Pataleshwar temple faces acute shortage of water
172.article_body: Pune's Pataleshwar cave temple is facing an acute shortage of water amid heat wave-like conditions in the city. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has now requested the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to provide a new water supply connection to the monument. "It has become difficult to manage the daily operations with the existing supply," an ASI official said.

173.title: He promised his mom he'll take them out of poverty: Ian Bishop on DC's Rovman Powell
173.article_body: Talking about Delhi Capitals (DC) batter Rovman Powell, Ian Bishop said, "He has come from humble beginnings. He promised his mom that he will take them out of poverty when he was still in secondary school." He added, "He is living that dream to do that." Rovman was bought by DC for ₹2.8 crore in the mega auction.

174.title: Not ready to move on: Babil remembers dad Irrfan on his death anniversary
