174.article_body: Actor Babil Khan on Friday penned a post remembering his late father Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary. "I'm not ready to move on...and I'm alright with the idea that...I will never be...You still breathe, in my thoughts," Babil wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture of the late actor. Irrfan was diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer in 2018.

175.title: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah named England’s Men’s Footballer of the Year
175.article_body: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah on Friday was named England's Men's Footballer of the Year in the annual vote by the Football Writers' Association (FWA). Salah got 48% of the votes ahead of Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne and West Ham United's Declan Rice. Salah, 29, has registered 30 goals and 14 assists in 44 appearances for Liverpool this season.

176.title: Man gets 8 yrs rigorous imprisonment for raping deaf-mute girl in J&K
176.article_body: A court in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur convicted a man of raping a deaf and mute girl and sentenced him to 8 years of rigorous imprisonment on Thursday. The convict, Karnail Singh, had barged into the girl's house six years ago and gagged and raped her, the officials said. A fine of ₹35,000 has also been imposed on him.

177.title: Zomato shares hit all-time low, wipe out half of investor wealth in 4 months
177.article_body: Shares of Zomato hit an all-time low of ₹71.15 on Friday, slipping below the lower band of IPO price in nine months since its stock market debut. Zomato has wiped out almost half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock hit a high of ₹142.45. The food delivery platform's shares are down more than 15% this month.

178.title: Tibet Prez compares Nehru's policy to that after 2014, blames Nehru's faith in China
178.article_body: Central Tibetan Administration President Penpa Tsering compared Jawaharlal Nehru's policy of recognising China's sovereignty over Tibet to that in India after 2014. Tsering said Nehru had "too much faith" in China and "he did what he thought was best for India". "I think India has changed his policy by not repeating that Tibet is part of [China]," he stated.

179.title: I won't question or beg the captain for the ball: KKR's Andre Russell
179.article_body: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said he wants to contribute more with the ball for his team in IPL 2022, but won't "question or beg" captain Shreyas Iyer for the ball. "I think everyone knows how important these last couple of games are," added Russell. Russell has picked 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

180.title: Insurtech startup Turtlemint raises $120 mn, reportedly at $900 mn valuation
180.article_body: Insurtech platform Turtlemint has raised $120 million in a Series E round led by Amansa Capital, Jungle Ventures and Nexus Venture Partners. The platform has closed the current financing round reportedly at a $900-950 million valuation. The round also saw participation from new investors Vitruvian Partners and Marshall Wace, along with other existing investors.

181.title: Ajay would give 1 shot & go back to being director: Rakul on Runway 34
181.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about 'Runway 34' co-star and director Ajay Devgn, said, "He was taking care of so many things." "From setting up, doing rehearsals, picturing every angle, every light to ensuring everything was bang on, he was more of...director," Rakul said, adding, "Then he'd just come to give one shot in a second and go back to being...director."

182.title: I'm sure Rohit, Kohli will get back in form in IPL 2022: Ganguly
182.article_body: Speaking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's batting performance in ongoing IPL, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he's sure both will get back in form in the upcoming matches. MI captain Rohit has scored 153 runs from eight matches at an average of 19.13, while ex-RCB skipper Kohli has managed 128 in nine matches, averaging 16.00, so far.

183.title: Around 8,000 British troops to take part in exercises in Europe: UK
183.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Friday said around 8,000 British Army troops will take part in exercises across eastern Europe in one of the largest deployments since the Cold War. Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said British service personnel will join with NATO allies for exercises amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine, which began on February 24.

184.title: Pakistani 'Made in China' drone shot down by BSF troops in Punjab
184.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by BSF troops near Dhanoe Kalan in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. The BSF said that troops deployed at the border intercepted the drone after they heard a buzzing sound of a suspected flying object entering India from Pakistan around 1.15 am. The 'Made in China' drone was recovered after an intensive search, it added.

185.title: 2 men killed, 3 others injured in collision between 2 cars in Pune
185.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were severely injured in a collision between two cars near Pune's Kavdipath toll plaza area. According to police, the accident took place when the driver of one of the cars rammed into the other car from the side. A case has been registered against the unidentified car driver for rash driving.

186.title: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals sent back since 2019: BSF report
186.article_body: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals have been sent back from the Indo-Bangladesh border since 2019, a BSF report said. It said at least 9,233 Bangladeshis were held at International Border while trying to flee after their illegal stay. "At least 4,896 Bangladeshi nationals were held while trying to enter India between January 1, 2019 and April 28, 2022," BSF report added.

187.title: LIC likely to list shares on exchanges on May 17
187.article_body: The shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) are likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which will be India's biggest ever, will open for subscription on May 4 and close on May 9. The government is expecting to raise ₹20,557 crore by diluting its 3.5% stake through the IPO.

188.title: CID arrests BJP's Divya Hagargi in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam
188.article_body: BJP leader Divya Hagargi was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka. Divya was reportedly caught from a hideout in Pune in Maharashtra. She runs Jnana Jyothi Institution which is an educational institution in Kalaburagi and was the 18th accused to be arrested in the case.

189.title: Open to buying if terms are right: Petroleum Minister on importing oil
189.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, India is open to buying oil from other countries as we've to look after our interests. "We're situated close to gulf countries like Iran which has lot of oil...We've energy relations with Russia, we buy crude from them but our total imports are not more than 0.2%," Puri added.

190.title: MP class 10, 12 board results released; 3.55 lakh class 10 students declared failed
190.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education on Friday declared results for classes 10 and 12. The Class 10 pass percentage is 59.54% and Class 12 pass percentage is 72.72%. A total of 3,55,371 Class 10 candidates have been declared failed. The last time the pass percentage was recorded below 60% for MP Class 10 board exam was in 2017.

191.title: Naga Chaitanya to make OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'
191.article_body: Naga Chaitanya will make his OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'. The actor's first look from the series, which is a supernatural horror thriller, was shared by Amazon Prime Video on Thursday. "As [an] actor, we always crave for our work to get maximum exposure and on a platform like Prime Video, we get that exposure," Chaitanya said.

192.title: Tata aims to build 80,000 EVs this financial year: Reuters
192.article_body: Tata Motors plans to ramp up its EV production and produce nearly 80,000 EVs in the current financial year, Reuters reported. The firm built and sold 19,000 EVs in the last financial year. At present, Tata Motors reportedly accounts for 90% of EV sales in India. The firm announced plans last year to launch 10 EV models by March 2026.

193.title: Woman injured in celebratory firing in Delhi, accused son absconding
193.article_body: A 54-year-old woman sustained bullet injuries during a celebratory firing at a wedding function at Matangi Bhawan in Delhi's Chhattarpur mandir on Thursday. The accused, who is absconding, is the woman's son, police confirmed. The injured woman was unconscious and unresponsive when the police reached the hospital to take her statement, a doctor said.

194.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to decline since end of March
194.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said global COVID-19 cases and deaths continued to drop since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 18 through April 24, over 4.5 million cases and over 15,000 deaths were reported globally, which is a decrease of 21% and 20%, respectively when compared to the previous week.

195.title: Greater demand for Alphonso mangoes in US this year: Exporters
195.article_body: The mango exporters of India said that for the first time there is a greater demand for Alphonso mango in US this year, compared to the traditional Kesar mango. "At the start of the season, we were apprehensive and so export volumes were lower than usual. However, US consumers lapped up the mangoes which went from India," an exporter said.

196.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest April day in over 40 years at 45.6°C
196.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in April in over 40 years at 45.6 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 44.8 degrees Celsius in the month of April in 1979. Notably, IMD has issued a heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram, for the next four days.

197.title: Chhavi Mittal shares pics with husband from hospital on anniversary, pens note
197.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent a six-hour-long surgery for breast cancer, celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary with her husband, Mohit Hussein, in hospital on Friday. Sharing some pictures with Mohit, she wrote, "I would choose you 100 times over as my life partner because the way you have stuck with me through everything, I don't think anyone could've."

198.title: South Korea to lift outdoor mask mandate
198.article_body: South Korea will lift an outdoor mask mandate starting next week. Health authorities said people will still be required to wear masks at outdoor gatherings of over 50 people and sporting and cultural events with potentially large crowds. South Korea reported 50,568 new COVID-19 cases on Friday. The country had removed most of its COVID-19 restrictions earlier this month.

199.title: HC adjourns hearing of Umar Khalid's bail plea to May 6 in Delhi riots case
199.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday adjourned Umar Khalid's bail plea hearing in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots case to May 6. "Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code is under challenge before the Supreme Court and is coming up for hearing on May 5. The findings on the 124A will have bearing on these cases as well," HC said.

200.title: Man hangs self after killing wife, 3-month-old daughter in UP's Bareilly
200.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly hanged himself after killing his 24-year-old wife and their three-month-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said. The incident came to light when the family members broke open the door when no one came out till late in the morning, police added. Prima facie it appears that the man died by suicide, police stated.

201.title: It was a tough start, but I was in form: Powell after win against KKR
201.article_body: Delhi Capitals batter Rovman Powell has said that he had to face a "tough start" during his match-winning knock of 33*(16) against KKR on Thursday. "Yeah, it was a tough start, but I was in form. In the early part of the season, I was going out for like one ball, two balls and those kinds of stuff," Powell said.

202.title: We see Rovman Powell as a finisher: DC skipper Rishabh Pant
202.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 33(16) against KKR, Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant said that they consider batter Rovman Powell as a "finisher" for the franchise. "Like today when we lost too many wickets, he (Powell) had to come up and do the job. We are not thinking about the points table and taking one game at a time," Pant said.

203.title: Depp's bodyguard asked in court about seeing him urinate, actor's reaction goes viral
203.article_body: Johnny Depp burst out laughing after his bodyguard Malcolm Connolly was asked in court if he had seen the actor urinate. Connolly replied 'No' to the question. "Mr Depp had his penis out of his pants, didn't he?" he was further asked, to which Connolly replied, "I think I'd remember if I'd seen Mr Depp's penis."

204.title: After failing to make it, Army aspirant dies by suicide in Haryana
204.article_body: An Army aspirant (23) died by suicide at the premises of a government school in a village in Haryana's Bhiwani district. According to the police, the aspirant had appeared in three Army recruitment drives but failed to make it to the final cut-off. The youngster's father claimed that the deceased had even crossed the age limit for eligibility as well.

205.title: Momentum turned after Umesh started with a wicket but gave 11 runs: Shreyas
205.article_body: Discussing KKR's defeat against DC by four wickets, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said, "[Pacer] Umesh Yadav started with a wicket but gave away 11 runs in the [first] over, that's where...the momentum turned." "You need to sit back and think where it's going wrong, can't be overconfident," added Shreyas. KKR are currently eighth on the IPL 2022 points table.

206.title: Mercedes looking at energy options should Russia cut gas delivery: CEO
206.article_body: Mercedes-Benz is looking at energy alternatives should Russia cut gas deliveries, CEO Ola Kaellenius said. "Every company is looking at options for diversifying energy sources," Kaellenius said. The automaker is working closely with German authorities to ensure energy supplies. "It is still too early to say exactly which scenario will happen," Kaellenius added.

207.title: Everything about it was wrong: Ponting on DC-RR no-ball controversy
207.article_body: Talking about the no-ball controversy during DC-RR match, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "Everything about it was wrong." He added, "The umpiring was wrong but you have to get on with it. For our players to remonstrate like they did and to have our assistant coach run out on the field, is not anything that we are happy with."

208.title: Yuvraj Singh trolls Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post
208.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled Gujarat Titans (GT) opener Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post. Gill shared pictures from GT's match against SRH, which GT won by scoring 25 runs in the last over. Referring to Gill getting out for 22(24) in the match, Yuvraj wrote, "Very entertaining your shot was," and shared a slipper emoji.

209.title: Power plants getting regular coal supplies: NTPC on Delhi govt's claim
209.article_body: The National Thermal Power Corporation Limited (NTPC) has responded to Delhi government's claims that only a day or two's stock is left at the Dadri-II and Unchahar power plants. "All six units of Dadri and five units of Unchahar are running at full capacity and receiving regular coal supplies. Present stock is 1,40,000 MT and 95,000 MT respectively," said NTPC.

210.title: Fire breaks out at jewellery office in Pune; no casualties reported
210.article_body: A fire broke out at an office of gold and silver jewellery work in Raviwar Peth in Pune in the early hours of Friday. A fire officer said that the situation was brought under control in a "quick time", adding that the cause of the fire was not ascertained. No casualties were reported and nobody was injured in the incident.

211.title: Chopping, changing opening pairs not ideal: Southee on KKR's loss vs DC
211.article_body: Talking about KKR's opening combinations following their four-wicket loss against DC in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Tim Southee said that "chopping and changing" isn't ideal but it happens when the team isn't winning a lot of matches. Both openers Aaron Finch(3) and Venkatesh Iyer(6) were dismissed by DC pacer Chetan Sakariya. KKR have six losses from nine matches so far.

212.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP hold meeting with senior MNS leaders in Pune
212.article_body: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) held a meeting with senior leaders of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Pune on Friday. This comes amid a controversy over loudspeakers in religious places. An MNS leader said both the groups have agreed to participate in the 'maha arti' on May 3, which will take place across Maharashtra.

213.title: Bride shot dead by man she was in relationship with at her wedding in UP
213.article_body: A bride was shot dead allegedly by her "jilted" lover at her wedding in Mathura's Mubarikpur village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday, police said. The accused had reportedly been in a relationship with the victim. "After 'Jai Mala', my daughter went to the room for refreshing up...an unknown person came in her room...shot her dead," the victim's father said.

214.title: Wreck of boat missing after accident that killed 14 found in Japan
214.article_body: The hull of a tour boat that went missing after an accident killed at least 14 people has been found underwater off the northern coast, said Japan's coast guard on Friday. The "Kazu I" went missing last Saturday off the island of Hokkaido with 26 people on board. Officials said 14 were found dead while the rest remain unaccounted for.

215.title: 7 arrested for throwing objectionable items outside mosques in UP's Ayodhya
215.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested for allegedly throwing objectionable items, including torn pages of holy books and inflammatory posters, outside three mosques and a shrine in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, police said. It was an attempt to create communal violence and incite riots in the city, police added. Eleven persons were involved in the conspiracy and four of them are absconding.

216.title: Germany’s Scholz praises Japan for its aid to Ukraine during visit
216.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Japan during a visit to the country for its support for Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. "From the start of Russia's war of aggression against Ukraine, Japan, as a G7 partner, has clearly and resolutely sided with Ukraine, Europe and the US," Scholz said. Japan is one of three Asian countries to impose sanctions on Russia.

217.title: BJP moves in right direction with right ideology: JP Nadda
217.article_body: Addressing a party programme in Ahmedabad, BJP's National President JP Nadda has said that BJP "is a party that moves in the right direction with the right ideology". "Anyone who wants to compete with our party will have to toil for 50-60 years. Our ideology is gaining global recognition...BJP is a party that...will take the country forward," Nadda said.

218.title: Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in March: Official
218.article_body: Maharashtra health department reported more than 300 cases of heat-related illness and 21 heatstroke deaths in March. According to State Surveillance Officer, Dr Pradip Awate, Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in the month of March. Notably, heat wave-like conditions have been prevailing over Pune as the city reported its hottest day in the season on Tuesday at 42 degrees Celsius.

219.title: Southern Command launches dedicated facility for veterans in Pune
219.article_body: The Southern Command on Thursday inaugurated a dedicated facility to address various concerns of the veterans from Pune military station. The aim of this node is to provide a single point access to the veterans, an official statement said. "It's a state-of-the-art complex with tailor-made workstations...to expeditiously provide information of various benefits and entitlements," it added.

220.title: Mumbai AC local train fare to be reduced by 50%: Union Minister Danve
220.article_body: The fare of AC local trains in Mumbai will be reduced by up to 50 percent, Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve said. He further informed that no changes will be made to the prices at which railway passes are sold. The existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of 5 km will be reduced to ₹30, Danve said.

221.title: No such instruction: Govt on reports of halting electric 2-wheeler launches
221.article_body: The government has denied reports claiming it has asked electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated. "There is no such instruction and such reports are unfounded, misleading and far from the truth," the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways tweeted. Earlier reports said government also cautioned manufacturers who haven't reported any fire incidents.

222.title: Mechanic dies after falling from 6th floor of Gurugram building while installing AC
222.article_body: An AC mechanic allegedly died after falling off the ledge from the sixth floor of a residential building while installing an AC in Gurugram's Sector 82. Kherki Daula SHO said the 20-year-old mechanic was repairing the AC with one leg on a concrete visor outside the window, which allegedly collapsed. He was not wearing a safety belt, the SHO added.

223.title: James Corden to step down as host of 'The Late Late Show' in 2023
223.article_body: James Corden will step down as the host of 'The Late Late Show' next year. The comedian has signed a one-year renewal contract with CBS which will come to an end by summer 2023. "It's been a really hard decision to leave because I'm so immensely proud of the show," said Corden, who began hosting the show in 2015.

224.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's father passes away, actor says 'Will miss our biryani outings'
224.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha's father Shyam Siddhartha passed away on Thursday at a hospital in Hyderabad. The actor, who works in the Telugu film industry, took to Twitter on Friday to pen a note remembering his late father. "Our RTC XRoads movie and biryani outings, travel, laughter, summers in Mumbai...will miss them all," Nikhil wrote while sharing a picture with his father.

225.title: Ecuador lifts both outdoor, indoor mask mandates
225.article_body: President Guillermo Lasso on Thursday said Ecuador will immediately remove both its outdoor and indoor mask mandates. Lasso added the decision was based on vaccination rates of 87% of the country's population aged three and older and a COVID-19 positivity rate of 5%. "It is a clear indicator that we have practically beaten COVID-19," he said.

226.title: Snake charmer held for dancing with cobra during marriage procession in Odisha
226.article_body: Odisha's Forest Department officials arrested a snake charmer, who was found dancing with a live cobra to the tune of a 'Naagin' song during a marriage procession at Karanjia area in Mayurbhanj. The forest officers reportedly recovered three live cobras from the snake charmer Ram Singh. The officers also interrogated four associates of Ram Singh who were dancing with him.

227.title: I supported Obama, but extremists have hijacked Democratic Party now: Musk
227.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has tweeted, "I strongly supported Obama for President, but today's Democratic Party has been hijacked by extremists." Earlier, he shared a diagram showing himself once being closer to moderate liberals on the centre-left but moving closer to conservatives on the centre-right as years progressed. The diagram also showed liberals moving to extreme left thinking.

228.title: T'gana Transport Minister lays foundation stone for nursing college in Hyd
228.article_body: Telangana Transport Minister, Ajay Kumar Puvvada, on Thursday laid the foundation stone for a nursing college at TSRTC Hospital in Hyderabad. The college will have 50 seats out of which five will be allotted to children of TSRTC employees, the minister said. He also inaugurated a 20-bedded ICU and an oxygen plant among other facilities at the hospital.

229.title: Fossil of largest raptor dinosaur discovered in Argentina
229.article_body: The fossil of the largest raptor dinosaur has been discovered in Argentina's Patagonia. The new species, named Maip macrothorax, was between nine and 10 metres long. It inhibited the southern tip of Argentina 70 million years ago. These megaraptors had an agile skeleton, a long tail and neck, an elongated skull with more than 60 small teeth and sharp-ended limbs.

230.title: Anti-human trafficking police rescues 10 minors, 4 women in J'khand
230.article_body: Ten minors and four women were rescued by the Railway Protection Force's (RPF) Anti-Human Trafficking Unit in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, an RPF officer said on Friday. The victims, who were about to board a train to Kerala's Ernakulam, were detained when they failed to give a satisfactory reply, the officer added. Some of the victims' Aadhaar cards were forged.

231.title: He knew what he was doing: Singapore on executing mentally challenged Indian-origin man
231.article_body: After 34-year-old mentally challenged Indian-origin Malaysian man, Nagaenthran Dharmalingam, was executed in a drug trafficking case in Singapore, the country's drug enforcement agency defended the execution saying Dharmalingam "knew what he was doing". It added that his actions showed he was "capable of manipulation and evasion" and he did not suffer from intellectual disability.

232.title: It's been a fresh start for us: Palak on equation with father Raja
232.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, daughter of Shweta Tiwari and her ex-husband Raja Chaudhary, spoke about her equation with her father and said that he's sober now and they're building their bond "from scratch". "People expect us to go back to being the perfect father-daughter duo, that's not how it works," she added. "It's been a fresh start for us," said Palak.

233.title: Will take strict action: Women commission chief on B'luru acid attack
233.article_body: After a woman was attacked with acid by a man in Bengaluru, Karnataka State Commission for Women Chairperson Pramila Naidu said that strict action would be taken against the culprit. According to police, the accused man, who had been following the woman for years, attacked her after she refused to marry him. Police have launched a hunt to nab him.

234.title: Coolest thing I've seen in a while: Mahindra on video of man driving customised vehicle
234.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted a video of a man driving a customised vehicle resembling an F1 car on an Indian road and carrying dairy products in it. "I'm not sure his vehicle meets road regulations, but I hope his passion for wheels remains unregulated," wrote Mahindra. "This is the coolest thing I've seen in...a long while," he added.

235.title: Ex-IAS officer Faesal reinstated 3 yrs after quitting, says 'idealism let me down'
235.article_body: Former IAS officer Shah Faesal, who had quit the service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, has been allowed to rejoin by the government. The 2009 batch UPSC topper had an eight-month-long stint in politics and was detained after Article 370 was abrogated. Referring to the period, Faesal said, "I lost almost everything...I'd built...My idealism had let me down."

236.title: Stones pelted, swords brandished during anti-Khalistan protest in Punjab's Patiala
236.article_body: Violence broke out between Shiv Sena and pro-Khalistani Sikh organisations on Friday over the former's anti-Khalistan protest near Shri Kali Devi Temple in Punjab's Patiala. Police personnel reportedly had to open fire and use tear gas shells to maintain law and order. In a video footage, pro-Khalistani groups were purportedly seen brandishing swords and pelting stones at Shiv Sena workers.

237.title: You almost broke my leg in my early 20s: AB de Villiers to Shoaib Akhtar
237.article_body: Recalling a match between South Africa and Pakistan, ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers told ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar on Twitter, "You almost broke my leg...in my early twenties after I decided to pull you for a six." "The minute it hit my bat I knew it was a big mistake," De Villiers wrote.

238.title: Zuckerberg's wealth increases by $11 billion in his biggest one-day gain ever
238.article_body: Meta Platforms' 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg added $11 billion to his fortune in the biggest one-day gain he has ever had, Bloomberg reported. His personal wealth surged as Meta shares soared 17.6% on Thursday after it reported that Facebook added more users than expected in first quarter of 2022. Zuckerberg is now the world's 12th-richest person with $75.9 billion wealth.

239.title: Tharoor pens poem on Kejriwal's sitting posture during meeting with PM Modi
239.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has penned a poem on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's sitting posture during a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi. "There once was a CM of Delhi, who stretched from his head to his belly. The onscreen reticulation, revealed his pandiculation. So BJP frothed & quivered like jelly!" Tharoor wrote. BJP Delhi had called Kejriwal "mannerless CM".

240.title: Umran's first ball to Hardik was absolute fire, he was stunned: Swann
240.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said SRH pacer Umran Malik's first delivery to GT captain Hardik Pandya in SRH's loss against GT was "absolute fire" and "stunned" Hardik. "Umran then bowled a rapid short delivery...got Hardik out," added Swann. Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022, Swann stated, "I will take Umran to Australia. Jasprit Bumrah's quick but...[not] express like Umran."

241.title: Activision Blizzard shareholders approve $68.7 bn Microsoft deal
241.article_body: Call of Duty-maker Activision Blizzard's shareholders have approved Microsoft's $68.7 billion proposal to buy the firm. Over 98% of the shares voted at a special meeting were in favour of the proposed transaction. Microsoft announced in January that it had agreed to acquire Activision Blizzard in its biggest acquisition to date. Microsoft's $26.2 billion LinkedIn acquisition is its second-biggest.

242.title: Rickshaw driver held for abetting suicide of live-in partner in Maharashtra
242.article_body: A 32-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested on Friday for allegedly abetting the suicide of his 28-year-old live-in partner in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, police said. The woman had parted ways with her husband due to domestic issues and had been living with the rickshaw driver for two years, police added. The woman allegedly hanged herself due to frequent harassment, police stated.

243.title: I have stolen one of the things that Nadal did on clay: Naomi Osaka
243.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said she has stolen one of the things that Nadal did when playing matches on clay courts, adding that it will either go really well or very badly. "I know that every kid growing up playing tennis in the world has pretended to be Nadal at least once," stated Osaka.

244.title: Heat wave warning issued for 15 states/UTs over 5 days, IMD releases list
244.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued heat wave warning for 15 states/UTs over five days. The states/UTs are: Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, West Bengal, Chhattisgarh and Gujarat. On Thursday, the IMD had issued orange alert for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha.

245.title: PM Modi inaugurates Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru
245.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru, saying, "Semiconductors are playing a critical role in the world in more ways than we can imagine." The conference is being organised by India Semiconductor Mission. "It's our collective aim to establish India as one of the key partners in the global semiconductors supply chain," PM Modi added.

246.title: Drugs worth ₹4.50 crore seized in Assam's Morigaon, 3 arrested
246.article_body: Three people were arrested after Assam Police seized a huge quantity of drugs worth around ₹4.50 crore from their possession in Morigaon district. The accused have been identified as Basir Khan, Altaf Khan and Jahidul Ali. "We have apprehended three persons and seized two trucks and a pick-up van. The seized trucks were coming from Manipur," police said.

247.title: Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Shabaash Mithu' to release on July 15
247.article_body: Taapsee Pannu on Friday took to Instagram to announce the release date of her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu'. The film, helmed by Srijit Mukherji, will release on July 15. "There is nothing more powerful than a girl with a dream and a plan to realise it!" wrote Taapsee, who essays the role of Indian cricketer Mithali Raj in the film.

248.title: I am nobody to decide role of Rahul Gandhi in Cong: Prashant Kishor
248.article_body: Prashant Kishor rejected reports which claimed that he suggested the name of Priyanka Gandhi to lead the Congress party and said that there was "no discussion" of Rahul or Priyanka in his meeting with party leaders. Kishor further said that he was nobody to decide the role of Rahul Gandhi in Congress. Kishor had recently declined offer to join Congress.

249.title: Video shows duo attacking 26-yr-old with a sword in Kalyan; booked
249.article_body: Police have booked two youths, identified as Nagesh Dalvi and Sandeep Rathore, after a video of them attacking 26-year-old Ajay Shirath with a sword at Kalyan's Mhasoba Chowk went viral on social media. Infuriated over an old dispute, the accused reportedly abused and attacked Shirath while he was crossing the street with a friend. He sustained injuries and was hospitalised.

250.title: US reports its 1st human H5 bird flu case
250.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has confirmed that the first known human case of H5 bird flu in the US has been confirmed in a prison inmate in Colorado. The person was involved in the culling of poultry presumed to have had H5N1 bird flu, the CDC said. The man experienced only fatigue.

251.title: Neetu Kapoor breaks down remembering Rishi Kapoor on reality show
251.article_body: Neetu Kapoor broke down in an episode of the reality show 'Dance Deewane Juniors' after a contestant's grandmother sang the song 'Lambi Judaai' while remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor. The actress, who's a judge on the show, said, "Rishi ji is not here but...every day, someone reminds me of him. Somehow, somewhere, he is still connected to me."

252.title: Amazon reports its first quarterly loss since 2015, loses $3.8 billion
252.article_body: E-commerce giant Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon's net loss for the first quarter of 2022 was $3.8 billion. "It...includes a pre-tax valuation loss of $7.6 billion included in non-operating expense from our common stock investment in Rivian Automotive," Amazon said. "Pandemic and subsequent war in Ukraine...brought unusual growth and challenges," CEO Andy Jassy stated.

253.title: Controversial slogans come up on walls of BHU campus; removed
253.article_body: Controversial slogans that had come up on the walls of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) campus in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi were removed on Thursday by the proctorial board's security and police personnel. The slogans were attributed to a BHU student organisation. However, the student organisation denied any involvement and termed it to be a "conspiracy" by anti-social elements to defame it.

254.title: When mom doesn't like my film, she says 'hatao, ye kya banaya hai?': Aamir
254.article_body: Aamir Khan in a recent interview spoke about how his mother responds when she doesn't like his films. "When she doesn't like something, she says 'Hatao, ye kya banaya hai?' (Put it away, what have you made)," he said. Speaking about his mother's reaction to the test screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Aamir said she liked the film a lot.

255.title: Following Musk's life is like taking notes while drinking from fire hose: Biographer
255.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's biographer Walter Isaacson has said dealing with Musk's life is "like trying to take notes while drinking from a fire hose. It keeps coming fast". He added everybody wants to talk about Musk and "everybody's got thoughts about him". "I don't think he's as random as he allows himself to appear," Isaacson said.

256.title: Telangana govt and Google sign pact for skill training of youth, women
256.article_body: Telangana government on Thursday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Google to provide skill training to the youth and women of the state. Under the agreement, Google will collaborate with state government to provide Google Career Certificate Scholarships to the youth. Further, Google will also start a "WomenWill" programme to train women in business and financial skills.

257.title: Mumbai-based lecturer duped of ₹80,000 while booking heli service
257.article_body: A Mumbai-based college assistant lecturer was duped of ₹80,000 by a cyber fraudster when the former was trying to book a helicopter ride from Sirsi (Karnataka) to Kedarnath (Uttarakhand). The 53-year-old complainant, who goes on Kedarnath Yatra every year, alleged that he was duped while booking the service for a group of 17 people, including him, through a website.

258.title: 5 policemen injured after scuffle with VHP members in Noida
258.article_body: At least five policemen were injured after a scuffle broke out between them and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members outside Noida's Sector 39 Police Station. "A group of people from VHP came...to get a person, who has been accused of rape, released," an official said. "An argument ensued and it turned into a scuffle," the official added.

259.title: Groom's family halts wedding over ladoos in Chhattisgarh
259.article_body: Upset over not serving ladoos, the groom's family allegedly halted a wedding in Chhattisgarh's Mungeli district. The groom's side reportedly objected to ladoos not being served during the wedding, which led to a brawl between them and the bride's side. When the matter reached the police station, cops intervened to settle the dispute, following which the marriage was solemnised.

260.title: Apple's Q2 revenue rises 9% y-o-y to record $97.3 billion
260.article_body: Apple announced that it has posted a March quarter revenue record of $97.3 billion, up 9% year-over-year. Its total profit was $25 billion up from over $23 billion recorded in the same period last year. Its iPad sales revenue fell 2% to $7.65 billion due to supply-chain constraints, while revenue from Mac computers rose 14.7% to $10.4 billion.

261.title: Chhattisgarh CM flags off 61 new vehicles to check crimes on highways
261.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel flagged off 61 new patrolling vehicles to prevent human trafficking and other crimes on the highways. Tweeting pictures from the event on Thursday, Baghel informed that out of the total vehicles, 15 will be dedicated for highway patrolling, 24 for anti-human trafficking and 22 for maintaining law and order in the state.

262.title: I feel embarrassed on the pitch, it's too painful: Man Utd’s De Gea
262.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said he feels "embarrassed" and "horrible" while playing for United. "When you are...3-0 or 4-0 down, it is too painful," added De Gea. "It is tough, I have been here for many years," stated De Gea. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League points table and trail fourth-placed Arsenal by five points.

263.title: Bus conductor killed as 3 buses catch fire in Punjab's Bathinda
263.article_body: A bus conductor was killed after three buses caught fire on Thursday night at Bhagta Bhai Ka town in Punjab's Bathinda, police said. The conductor was sleeping in one of the buses when the incident occurred at the bus stand, police added. "There were three employees of a private transport company guarding their two buses," police further said.

264.title: Which states/UTs are on the brink of power outage amid heatwave?
264.article_body: India is witnessing the worst electricity shortage in over six years amid the heatwave. Several states/UTs are on the brink of power outage due to the increased demand of coal. They include Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Rajasthan, Kerala and Punjab. The electricity demand shot up by 40% in Punjab, while in Rajasthan, it has increased by 31%.

265.title: Hundreds of passenger trains cancelled for movement of coal amid power crisis
265.article_body: Hundreds of passenger trains have been cancelled for movement of coal carriages amid power crisis in India. Several parts of India are facing long hours of blackouts, while some industries are cutting output due to the fossil fuel's shortage. The measure is temporary and passenger services will be restored as soon as the situation normalises, an Indian Railways official said.

266.title: Ammonia leaks from H'yana factory; breathing difficulties reported
266.article_body: Workers at a factory in Haryana's Jhajjar were evacuated and water was sprayed after the factory reported an ammonia gas leak on Thursday night. Some residents in the area complained of difficulty in breathing and vomiting, while the condition of two firefighters reportedly also deteriorated during the relief work. Meanwhile, the Additional Deputy Commissioner advised people to wear masks.

267.title: Violence doesn’t benefit anybody: Mohan Bhagwat on communal violence incidents
267.article_body: Speaking about the communal clashes which erupted in some states during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that violence does not benefit anybody. "The society to which violence is dear is now counting its last days...For this, it is essential to bring together all communities...We all need to do this work on a priority," Bhagwat said.

268.title: Illegal arms dealer held in Kolkata, 2 country-made pistols recovered
268.article_body: The Special Task Force of Kolkata Police arrested an illegal arms dealer from city's Parsi Bagan lane area on Thursday. The police also recovered two country-made improvised firearms along with other items. The accused, identified as Ajijur Momin, is a resident of Malda. He will be produced before the court on Friday.

269.title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp extends contract until 2026
269.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has signed a contract extension until 2026 with his previous deal due to expire in 2024. "There is a freshness about us as a club...and this energises me," said Klopp. Ex-Liverpool player José Enrique had earlier tweeted that Klopp's contract extension is better than Liverpool signing forwards Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland at the same time.

270.title: Real tech skills lead to remarkable outcomes: Scaler
270.article_body: Scaler Academy highlights the value of real tech skills for impactful career results. It promises the right learning environment including dedicated mentorship & an industry-fit curriculum taught by experienced instructors. From achieving 126% average salary hike to being placed at top tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Flipkart & more, our alumni utilise skills to create impact, said Scaler.

271.title: Boman shares pic with Vicky, Anupam; fan says 'Too much talent in 1 frame'
271.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Boman Irani shared a picture of himself with Anupam Kher and Vicky Kaushal. "He's what we call 'a good lad'...A gentle soul and a lot more dear, Vicky Kaushal," he wrote. Reacting to Boman's post, a fan wrote, "Too much talent in one frame," while another said, "It'd be good to see...three of you together on screen."

272.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor to get first train next month
272.article_body: The priority section of the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) will get its first train for the Delhi-Meerut route next month. The first train set will arrive from the Savli plant in Gujarat, an official said. The 17 km-long priority section, which is between Sahibabad and Duhai depot (Ghaziabad), will be made operational for public use by March next year.

273.title: 22-yr-old mentally challenged man sodomised in Ludhiana; 1 booked
273.article_body: Punjab Police booked one person after a 22-year-old mentally challenged man was allegedly sodomised in Ludhiana's Assi Kalan village. His mother told police that her son had gone for a walk on April 25 when the accused took him to bushes near canal and sexually assaulted him. He threatened him with dire consequences if he spoke to anyone, she alleged.

274.title: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge raises ₹153 crore
274.article_body: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge has raised around ₹153 crore in its Series B funding round led by Florintree. The round also saw participation from its existing investors such as ﻿Celesta Capital﻿, Infosys, Qualcomm and Infina, along with the Exim Bank of India. The startup claims to be having repeat contracts from the Indian Army for its SWITCH UAVs.

275.title: Hindu activists threaten 'suicide' over UP rly station temple's removal
275.article_body: Hindu right-wing activists have allegedly threatened to commit mass suicide if a 250-year-old temple is removed from the Raja Ki Mandi Railway Station's platform in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. This comes after Railways had issued a notice to shift the temple from the station's premises. A similar notice was also sent to a dargah and mosque at Agra Cantt Railway Station.

276.title: Chiranjeevi wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted: Sood on playing antagonist
276.article_body: Sonu Sood has said his philanthropy work has made it difficult for people to cast him in negative roles as they are afraid that audience might not accept it. The actor, who plays an antagonist in 'Acharya', added the makers had to "rework...on a few scenes" after COVID-19. "Chiranjeevi...wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted by people," said Sood.

277.title: I don't know what is going on in Virat Kohli's head: Ganguly on Kohli's poor form
277.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor batting form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know what is going on in Kohli's head." He added, "But I am sure he will regain his form and get some good runs. He is a great player." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

278.title: IndiGo becomes first airline to land aircraft using Indian navigation system 'GAGAN'
278.article_body: IndiGo has become the first airline in India to land its aircraft using the indigenous navigation system 'GAGAN'. The airline said the flight was conducted using an ATR aircraft and landed at Kishangarh airport in Rajasthan on Wednesday morning. GPS-aided geo-augmented navigation (GAGAN) has been developed jointly by Airports Authority of India (AAI) and Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

279.title: What action has IMD suggested amid heat wave in several parts of the country?
279.article_body: Amid intensifying heat wave in several parts of the country, IMD has suggested action for citizens. It has urged citizens to avoid heat exposure and avoid dehydration. "Drink sufficient water, even if not thirsty. Wear lightweight, light-coloured, loose, cotton clothes and cover the head by use of cloth, hat or umbrella etc," it said.

280.title: People run for their lives as US family brings unexploded shell at airport in Israel
280.article_body: A video shows people running for their lives at an airport in Israel after a US family brought an unexploded shell. The family picked up the artillery shell while in Golan Heights and decided to pack it in their luggage, according to authorities. The family was allowed to board their flight after being interrogated by security, who declared an all-clear.

281.title: Don't employ bouncers at bars, pubs in GB Nagar: Excise dept
281.article_body: The excise department met all GB Nagar based pub and bar owners and directed them not to employ bouncers at their establishments. This comes after a 30-year-old man died after he was allegedly assaulted during a brawl in a pub in Noida's Gardens Galleria mall. Excise officials said there are 83 licenses issued for pubs and bars in GB Nagar.

282.title: 97 kg heroin, other drugs worth ₹300 cr seized from house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh
282.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Thursday seized over 97 kilograms of heroin, 47 kilograms of other narcotics and ₹30 lakh cash from a house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, officials said. The seized drugs are worth ₹300 crore, as per reports. "The drugs...stored in travel bags, backpacks and jute sacks. We suspect...money seized was received through Hawala channels," police said.

283.title: It hurts when I see the situation of Barcelona: Ex-Barca manager Koeman
283.article_body: Ex-Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman said it "hurts" him when he sees the situation of Barcelona, adding that changing the manager doesn't always mean being able to improve. "I didn't have the club's full support. I hope [current manager] Xavi does," stated Koeman. Barcelona trail Real Madrid, who are on top of the La Liga points table by 15 points.

284.title: WB govt making special provisions for Ukraine-returned citizens: CM
284.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the government is making special provisions for all the 422 Ukraine-returned citizens from the state, including 419 students. "The Union government has shown an indifferent approach about their future," she added. "We have already employed two persons as contractual workers at the district magistrate's office," Banerjee further said.

285.title: KKR have many loopholes, death bowling has always been an issue: Jaffer
285.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said KKR have many loopholes like their openers not doing well and spinners not being as impressive, adding that their death bowling has "always" been an issue. "KKR are relying heavily on Shreyas Iyer and Andre Russell. The other guys [should]...step up," added Jaffer. KKR recorded their fifth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022 against DC.

286.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune in 4th hike this month
286.article_body: The price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) was hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune on Thursday for the fourth consecutive time in April, taking the CNG price to ₹77.20/kg in the city. In April, CNG price witnessed a hike from ₹62.20 to ₹68, then to ₹73. On April 19, the price again raised to ₹75, before the latest hike.

287.title: Manish Pandey hasn't looked in good rhythm since 2-3 seasons: Chawla
287.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said LSG batter Manish Pandey has "not looked" in good rhythm in IPL 2022 so far, adding that Pandey hasn't been in good rhythm since the last two to three IPL seasons. "It is a concern," added Chawla. Manish has scored 88 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 110.

288.title: 57-yr-old man dies during raid on video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund
288.article_body: A 57-year-old man died during a police raid on a video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund area on Thursday. According to an official, the crime branch had raided the parlour for allegedly operating illegally around 5 pm. The deceased, who was among those detained, began feeling unwell and was rushed to hospital where he was declared dead, the official added.

289.title: Hyderabad Police detains 3 men for cheating people via investment scam
289.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday detained three men for allegedly cheating people of about ₹6 crore on the pretext of an investment fund with high-interest rates. According to police, the accused lured people by giving them 10% interest on their initial invested amount. Though people received returns in beginning, later the accused stopped responding to the victims, police added.

290.title: Wedding procession moves under shade of pandal amid heatwave in India; video viral
290.article_body: In a video being widely circulated on social media, a wedding procession is seen moving ahead under the shade of a pandal amid the heatwave in the country. The clip shared by Twitter user Devyani Kohli has more than 19,000 views so far. Reacting to the video, users commented, "We are Jugaad king," and "Amazing."

291.title: DC's Sakariya's wicket celebration goes viral, says 'It was for my late father'
291.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya's 'Black Panther' and 'Goku' celebration after taking KKR opener Aaron Finch's wicket went viral. Talking about it, Sakariya said, "It was an emotional celebration. It was for my late father. He always wanted me to clean bowl an international batter." "[The celebration] signifies me going to my father and telling him, 'I did it'," he stated.

292.title: Man sexually harasses sister, her 9-yr-old daughter in Pune; held
292.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly sexually harassing his sister and her nine-year-old daughter. The man's mother claimed that in one incident her son pulled down her granddaughter's clothes and in another, he tugged at her hand and asked her to come to his bed after eating dinner. Both the incidents reportedly occurred in April.

293.title: Only impart Bible-based moral science lessons: B'luru school head
293.article_body: The principal of Bengaluru's Clarence High School, which is involved in the Bible row, had denied the allegation that non-Christian students are forced to learn the Bible and said that only moral science lessons based on the text are imparted. He added that parents and students actually "appreciate" the school for teaching moral values and this has invited more admissions.

294.title: Pakistan PM, ministers received with chants of 'chor-chor' in Saudi; video surfaces
294.article_body: A video shows people chanting "chor-chor" as Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and other ministers made their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Medina. Sharif and his delegation had reached Saudi Arabia on Thursday for a three-day official visit. "I don't want to name the person responsible for this," Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said in an apparent reference to ex-PM Imran Khan.

295.title: Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase under probe in US: Report
295.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase in early April is being probed by the US FTC, The Information reported. The FTC is probing if Musk complied with an antitrust reporting requirement when he bought the stake. It's focussing on whether Musk bought the stake to influence Twitter's management or if he looked to be a passive shareholder.

296.title: Moment of pride: Arvind Kejriwal praises Atishi on her UN address
296.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal congratulated AAP leader Atishi on her UN General Assembly address and called it "a very proud moment". Atishi highlighted the AAP government's governance model at the UNGA. "Many congratulations on making the whole world aware of the potential of the country including the sentiments of the people of Delhi...India now wants to move forward," Kejriwal said.

297.title: 26-year-old woman accuses Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape
297.article_body: A 26-year-old woman on Thursday accused Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape, police said. The woman lodged a complaint at Mumbai's Sakinaka Police Station, an official said. No FIR has been registered so far and the police were yet to start a probe into the complaint, the official added. Shewale has denied the accusation and called the complaint "conspiracy".

298.title: Himachal's Sach Pass reopens for light vehicles after 6 months
298.article_body: The Sach Pass, which connects Chamba with the remote Pangi valley in Himachal Pradesh, has been reopened for light vehicles after a gap of over six months, said Deputy Commissioner DC Rana. The snow clearance operation has been partially completed at the pass, Rana added. "The work to open the route for heavy vehicles is still underway," he said.

299.title: Committed to helping you invest as the ultra-wealthy do: dezerv.
299.article_body: Co-founders of dezerv., who have managed money for India's wealthiest families for 16+ years, believe that India has one of the greatest wealth inequalities. This defined their mission: to help working professionals invest as the ultra-wealthy do. They believe every person should have access to experts for their investments to avoid mistakes that could make them lose their hard-earned money.

300.title: Vidya to reunite with 'Shakuntala Devi' director for murder mystery 'Neeyat'
300.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan is reuniting with 'Shakuntala Devi' director Anu Menon for another film, titled 'Neeyat'. The upcoming murder mystery will also feature Ram Kapoor, Shahana Goswami, Shashank Arora, Mita Vasisht, Prajakta Koli, Neeraj Kabi and Amrita Puri. "I have loved the work of all...people working on this movie...It feels great to be working with all of them," Vidya said.

301.title: Man puts up loudspeakers at temples in UP's Saharanpur; arrested
301.article_body: A man was arrested on Thursday for allegedly putting up loudspeakers at temples in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. This comes a day after the state government said that it had removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places. The man, Vishu Kambojh alias Shanky, was identified as a member of the Hindu Yodha Parivar, the city's Superintendent of Police said.

302.title: SRH will feel the pain when he scores: Sehwag on Warner's 26-ball 42 vs KKR
302.article_body: Talking about DC opener David Warner's 42 off 26 balls in DC's win against KKR, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said Warner's former franchise SRH will feel the "pain" whenever he scores runs. "Warner deserves credit for SRH's title victory [in 2016]," added Sehwag. Warner was picked by DC in the IPL mega auction having been earlier released by SRH.

303.title: China's Weibo publishes users' IP locations to combat 'bad behaviour'
303.article_body: China's Weibo has started publishing users' IP locations on their account pages and when they post comments, in a move to combat "bad behaviour" online. For users in China, Weibo will display their province or municipality, while for overseas users IP addresses will be shown. Several users welcomed Weibo's decision, while several others brought up anonymity issues.

304.title: No major communal violence in past 7-8 yrs: Naqvi to EU team
304.article_body: Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi who on Thursday met a European Union (EU) delegation, told Indian Express that he clarified to them that "there's been no major incident of communal violence in the past seven-eight years." He said that he did so after the delegation raised concerns over bureaucrats writing PM Narendra Modi a letter on the matter.

305.title: Mohammad Kaif names his all-time IPL XI, includes 5 Indians
305.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif has named his all-time IPL XI, which includes five Indians and six foreigners. Kaif named Chris Gayle and Rohit Sharma as openers, and MS Dhoni as the wicketkeeper-captain of the side. Other players include Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, AB de Villiers, Andre Russell, Rashid Khan, Sunil Narine, Jasprit Bumrah and Lasith Malinga.

306.title: India reports 3,377 COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths in last 24 hours
306.article_body: India reported 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,303 COVID-19 cases and 39 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,801, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,753.

307.title: Airbnb tells employees they can work remotely forever
307.article_body: Airbnb told its 6,000 employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely. The home-renting marketplace also told its US employees that they could move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that permanent flexibility will allow the company to "hire and retain the best people in the world".

308.title: Woman forced to give massage to policeman inside Bihar police station; video surfaces
308.article_body: A woman was forced to give massage to a police official inside a police station in Bihar's Saharsa district to reportedly get her son out of jail. The police official has been suspended after the video of him receiving massage went viral on social media. Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO), Sadar, Santosh Kumar confirmed the authenticity of the video.

309.title: BMC reduces number of COVID-19 vaccination centres due to low turnout
309.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is shutting down COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) with zero or less than 10% footfall as the civic body said that Mumbai's adult population is now fully vaccinated. The number of people eligible for booster doses is close to four lakh and these people won't turn up together at the same time, the BMC said.

310.title: Name villages after Milkha, Lata, Rafi: Delhi BJP to Kejriwal
310.article_body: Delhi Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) chief Adesh Gupta has asked Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to rename 40 villages, including Hauz Khas and Sheikh Sarai, in the national capital on Thursday. He suggested these villages should be named after singers Lata Mangeshkar and Mohammed Rafi, shehnai maestro Bismillah Khan, sportsperson Milkha Singh and Kargil war martyr Captain Vikram Batra among others.

311.title: Demolition firm seeks time extension in Noida Supertech twin towers case
311.article_body: Edifice Engineering, the firm hired by Supertech to demolish the 40-storey Noida twin towers on May 22, has sought an extension of time, citing inputs from foreign experts engaged for the work. "The engineering firm has to comply with the agreement signed with Supertech," Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari said. "We can't allow time extensions on our own," Maheshwari added.

312.title: Aave CEO briefly suspended from Twitter after joke on being its interim CEO
312.article_body: DeFi protocol Aave's CEO Stani Kulechov's Twitter account was briefly suspended after he joked about being appointed Twitter's "interim CEO". However, less than 24 hours after the suspension, Twitter reversed its decision. After the suspension was lifted, Kulechov tweeted, "I'm back as interim CEO of Twitter." Prior to his suspension, Kulechov had thanked Elon Musk for the opportunity.

313.title: Chinchwad remains hottest area in Pune for 3rd straight day
313.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave-like conditions, Chinchwad (43.6°C) remained the hottest area of Pune city for the third consecutive day on Thursday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Other areas which followed Chinchwad were Lavale (42.6°C), Shivajinagar and Pashan (41.8°C) and Lohegaon (41.7°C). Notably, Pune's day temperature was 3 to 5 degrees above normal, IMD's data said.

314.title: It shocked me: UN chief as 2 Russian missiles hit Ukraine during his visit
314.article_body: After two Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv during a visit by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres, he said, "It shocked me, not because I'm here but because Kyiv is a sacred city for Ukrainians and Russians alike." Meanwhile Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the blasts "prove that we must not drop our vigilance".

315.title: Want to make the biggest show: Rohit Shetty on 'Indian Police Force'
315.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty, speaking about his upcoming show 'Indian Police Force', said, "My only aim is to make it big. The biggest series." "We've been watching a lot of series from abroad...Nothing wrong in it but it's time something has to go from India...that's what I want to do," he added. It stars Sidharth Malhotra, Shilpa Shetty and Vivek Oberoi.

316.title: None of their players have got going: Vettori on KKR's loss vs DC
316.article_body: Reacting to KKR's defeat by four wickets against DC, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "None of their players have just been able to get going." "[Opener] Aaron Finch has been unsettled," added Vettori. "KKR have more questions to answer than DC," stated former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop. KKR have now recorded their fifth consecutive defeat.

317.title: Jharkhand govt has become king of thieves: Arjun Munda
317.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda criticised the JMM-led Jharkhand government and said that the state government has become the "king of thieves". "What is happening in Jharkhand? Illegal mining is being done, loots, coal 'mafiagiri' is being done openly. The state government is not understanding why the public has chosen them... there's a lot of mismanagement," the former Jharkhand CM said.

318.title: Ugandan student falls to death from hostel's 6th floor in B'luru
318.article_body: A 24-year-old student from Uganda died after she fell from the sixth floor of the hostel building at Gitam University in Bengaluru's Doddaballapura. The incident reportedly occurred on Wednesday when the deceased tried to pick up clothes that'd fallen on a sheet at the building's edge. The death led to protests by students and some students also vandalised buildings.

319.title: Man molests 13-yr-old girl at Mumbai's Dadar railway station, held
319.article_body: A 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 13-year-old girl at Dadar railway station in Mumbai. The incident occurred on Wednesday evening when the girl was sitting with her grandfather on a bench. The accused allegedly sat down next to the victim and started touching her inappropriately following which she raised an alarm, police said.

320.title: Bus hits 9 vehicles after brake failure in Pune; 1 dead, 7 injured
320.article_body: At least one person died and seven others were injured after a Maharashtra state transport bus rammed into nine other vehicles in Pune's Balaji Nagar on Thursday, police officials said. The incident allegedly occurred as the driver lost control due to suspected brake failure, a police inspector said. Over 20 passengers were on board the bus when the incident occurred.

321.title: 3-yr-old killed, 10 injured as vehicle falls into gorge in Chamba
321.article_body: A three-year-old boy died and nine other children were injured after a Bolero carrying them fell into a gorge in Chamba. The driver, along with three children, has been seriously injured. As per police, the vehicle that used to ferry students of a private school met with an accident after the driver lost control of it while negotiating a curve.

322.title: Power supply to Metro, hospitals could be interrupted amid coal shortage: Delhi govt
322.article_body: Coal crisis in the national capital could hit essential services like Delhi Metro and hospitals, Delhi government said on Thursday. Coal in two of the five stations from where Delhi sources power would last only about one or two days, it added. "Delhi government...appealed to the Centre to provide an adequate supply of coal," Power Minister Satyendar Jain said.

323.title: Shahid Afridi is characterless, he conspired against me for being a Hindu: Kaneria
323.article_body: Ex-Pakistan leg-spinner Danish Kaneria claimed that Shahid Afridi conspired against him for being a Hindu. "I was always degraded by Afridi...He didn't want me to be in team...He'd go to other players and provoke them against me. I was performing well and he was jealous of me," Kaneria added. "He was a liar, manipulator...because he's a characterless person," Kaneria stated.

324.title: Fireball flying at 88,500 kmph spotted over US, causes loud boom
324.article_body: A fireball was spotted by residents of US' states of Arkansas, Louisiana and Mississippi. Several people reported hearing loud booms. As per NASA, the object, thought to be a piece of an asteroid, was about a foot in diameter and weighed 40 kg. "[It] moved southwest at a speed of 55,000 mph (over 88,500 kmph)," NASA further said.

325.title: Mumbai's Mulund station bags award for best cleaned suburban station of CR
325.article_body: Mumbai division's Mulund station bagged the award for being the cleanest suburban station on Central Railway and Asangaon stood second in the same category. At present, Mulund station handles around 1,000 local trains daily, experiencing an average daily footfall of around 2.5 lakh passengers. Mulund station has 54 twin dustbins for the segregation of waste at the source.

326.title: India responds after Pakistan PM Sharif terms PM Modi's visit to J&K as 'staged'
326.article_body: After Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif termed PM Narendra Modi's visit to J&K as "staged", External Affairs Ministry said, "Pakistan has no locus standi to comment on matters pertaining to the Union Territory." "We don't understand the word staged. It seems to indicate the visit did not take place and we are trying to show that it did," the ministry added.

327.title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $4 bn, says no further sales planned
327.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million Tesla shares worth nearly $4 billion, filings showed. Commenting on the sale he said, "No further TSLA sales planned after today." Earlier this week, Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that Musk may sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44-billion Twitter deal.

328.title: Woman in possession of swamp deer horns worth ₹1.5 cr held in Delhi
328.article_body: A 23-year-old woman possessing swamp deer horns worth around ₹1.5 crore was arrested from Delhi's Timarpur area, police said. The woman, a resident of Aruna Nagar, allegedly wanted to sell the horns, according to the police. The accused revealed that she had bought the horns from a resident of UP's Bahraich to sell them in Delhi, police added.

329.title: Gurugram to soon offer option of booking city bus seats using Uber
329.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan City Bus Limited will soon start a special bus service where commuters can book their bus seats through the Uber app, making it a first-of-its-kind service in India. The special service will initially run on pilot basis for nine months on two routes. The buses will make three round trips each in the morning and evening.

330.title: DC hand KKR their 5th straight defeat in IPL 2022, move to 6th on IPL 2022 points table
330.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by four wickets in their IPL 2022 match to move to the sixth position on the points table. KKR have now lost five matches in a row and are placed eighth on the points table. David Warner top-scored for DC with 42(26), while Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets.

331.title: 7 people arrested for throwing objectionable items outside mosques in Ayodhya
331.article_body: Police has arrested seven persons for allegedly throwing objectionable items and torn pages of religious texts outside three mosques and a shrine in Ayodhya on Wednesday. "It came to light that they wanted to ruin the amicable atmosphere and peaceful tradition of this city," Senior Superintendent of Police (Ayodhya) Shailesh Kumar Pandey said. Four people are yet to be arrested.

332.title: Get listed in India, don't leave for 'few dollars more': Goyal to startups
332.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday urged startups to get incorporated and listed in India and not leave the country "just for few dollars more". "If you have an issue or problem, please tell us about it. We'll...make every effort to resolve [it]," Goyal said. He added that startups too need to strengthen ethics and corporate governance standards.

333.title: Govt asks state-run firms to consider buying Russian oil assets: Report
333.article_body: The Oil Ministry has reportedly asked state-run energy firms, including ONGC Videsh Ltd (OVL) and Indian Oil Corporation, to consider buying BP's stake in sanction-hit Russia's petroleum firm Rosneft. It comes after BP announced it's exiting its 19.75% stake in Rosneft. India hopes to get stakes in Russian assets at discounted rates given the risk involved, a source told Reuters.

334.title: Centre should take steps to curb fuel price hike: Kerala CM
334.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that people's suffering due to fuel price hike cannot be mitigated by blaming the states. The Centre should take steps to curb the increase in the rates, he added. This comes a day after PM Narendra Modi said non-reduction of VAT by some states was the reason for skyrocketing costs of fuel.

335.title: Congress can revive itself, doesn't need me: Prashant Kishor
335.article_body: After declining Congress' offer to join the party, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that the Congress can revive itself and does not need him. "The Congress leadership and I agreed on several things with regard to the party's future plan," Kishor said. They can revive the party on their own, they have so many big leaders, he added.

336.title: Olivia Wilde served custody documents from ex-fiance on stage: Report
336.article_body: Actress Olivia Wilde was handed over an envelope which reportedly consisted of legal custody documents of her children from her ex-fiance Jason Sudeikis while she was on stage at the CinemaCon. "Jason would never condone her being served in such an inappropriate manner," a source close to Jason told Variety. The duo were engaged but got separated in 2020.

337.title: My picture was uploaded on a porn site when I was 15: Urfi Javed
337.article_body: Urfi Javed recalled an incident of slut-shaming when she was 15. "I was in Lucknow...and I wore an off-shoulder top. In Lucknow, we never got such clothes back then...I uploaded the picture on Facebook and someone uploaded that on a porn site," she said. "People...slut-shamed me, the entire town, my family...they were like 'It was all your fault'," said Urfi.

338.title: Electric pole falls on man, 4 Navi Mumbai civic staff booked
338.article_body: At least four members of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) were booked for negligence after a street pole fell on a food vendor. The incident took place when NMMC staff were erecting a new street light pole in Sanpada. Food vendor Ganesh Chelaswami Hikutty went to enquire when the work would be done and the pole fell on his shoulder.

339.title: Twitter overcounted its users for 3 years due to an error
339.article_body: Twitter admitted it overcounted its monetisable daily active usage/users (mDAU) from Q1 2019 through Q4 2021. "In March 2019, we launched a feature to let people link multiple separate accounts together to conveniently switch between accounts," said Twitter. "An error was made at that time...actions taken via primary account resulted in all linked accounts being counted as mDAU," added Twitter.

340.title: Parliamentary panel summons Amazon, Google over competitive conduct
340.article_body: The Parliamentary Panel on Finance has said it'll summon Google, Amazon, Twitter, Facebook, Apple and Microsoft among others to discuss their competitive behaviour. It comes as the Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Thursday told the panel that it was setting up a 'Digital Markets and Data Unit' for dealing with anti-competition practices of big tech companies.

341.title: Main accused in Rajasthan doctor suicide case arrested
341.article_body: The main accused in the alleged suicide case of Dr Archana Sharma was arrested by police in Dausa, Rajasthan. Police said the accused, Shiv Shanker Joshi alias Baliya Joshi, was arrested outside a news channel office as soon as he came out. Gynaecologist Dr Archana Sharma allegedly died by suicide on March 29 after a case was registered against her.

342.title: Delhi sees warmest April day in 12 years at 43.5° C: Report
342.article_body: Delhi witnessed its warmest April day in 12 years on Thursday amid heatwave, with the Safdarjung observatory recording a maximum temperature of 43.5° C, PTI reported. Delhi had registered a maximum temperature of 43.7° C on April 18, 2010, while its all-time high temperature for April was 45.6° C recorded on April 29, 1941, the report added.

343.title: Delhi sees nearly 1,500 new COVID-19 cases, active cases cross 5,000
343.article_body: Delhi's active COVID-19 cases have crossed the 5,000 mark on Thursday as nearly 1,500 (1,490) people tested positive for the virus in the city in the last 24 hours. The national capital also reported two coronavirus-related deaths on Thursday, while 1,070 people recovered from the disease in one day. Delhi's daily positivity rate jumped to 4.62% from 4.50% on Wednesday.

344.title: Google blocked 12 lakh Play Store apps, 1.9 lakh developers in 2021
344.article_body: Google has revealed that it blocked 12 lakh "policy violating apps" from being published on Play Store in 2021. According to Google, it also banned 1,90,000 "malicious and spammy" developer accounts and closed around 5,00,000 developer accounts that were "inactive or abandoned". "Last year we introduced multiple privacy-focused features...and improved SDK data safety," Google stated.

345.title: Maha govt delaying establishment of Vajpayee statue in Mumbai: BJP
345.article_body: BJP MP Gopal Shetty has accused the Maharashtra government of deliberately delaying the establishment of the statue of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee in Mumbai's Kandivali. "Permission from the 12 departments of the Maharashtra government has been granted," Gopal Shetty said. One minister belonging to the Sports department of Congress quota has not permitted it yet, he added.

346.title: Use bulldozers on criminals, not on temples: BJP MP to Raj govt
346.article_body: Condemning Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot over the Dausa gang-rape and murder, Rajasthan BJP MP Ram Kumar Verma said that the government should use bulldozers on criminals and not on temples. "The Home Minister who is also the Chief Minister is responsible for such incidents because he has no control over it and has become insensitive," Verma said.

347.title: Israelis across country observe 2-minute silence to mark Holocaust Day
347.article_body: Israelis on Thursday paused as two-minute sirens across the country sounded off to mark Holocaust Remembrance Day, an annual ritual honouring 6 million Jews killed during World War II. People halted where they were walking and drivers stepped out of their vehicles to bow their heads in memory of victims. Over 1,60,000 survivors of the Holocaust live in Israel today.

348.title: No Entry 2 will star Salman, Anil, Fardeen; shoot to begin soon: Anees
348.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that the shooting 'No Entry' sequel is going to start "very soon". "I've met Salman Khan four to five times and I've told him that we'll start filming soon," he added.
