Anees confirmed that Anil Kapoor and Fardeen Khan, who were part of the 2005 film, will also feature in the sequel.

349.title: Ukraine war delayed delivery of Vande Bharat trains' components: MEA
349.article_body: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the delivery of components of the Vande Bharat trains has been affected by the Russia-Ukraine war. "The war has impacted [the] delivery schedule [of the trains' components]. We are looking at options to ensure timely delivery," Bagchi said. India had reportedly ordered 36,000 wheels for $16 million from a firm based in Ukraine.

350.title: Ukraine conflict highlights need for self-reliance: Rajnath Singh
350.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict highlighted the need for achieving self-reliance in defence. "Indian Navy, which has been at the forefront of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative, must continue to lead the way and remain a necessary guarantor of India's maritime trade, security and national prosperity," Singh said.

351.title: Adam Levine is the reason wife Portia & I are together: Ellen
351.article_body: 'The Ellen Show' host Ellen DeGeneres said singer Adam Levine is the reason why she and her wife Portia de Rossi are together. In a recent appearance on 'The Ellen Show', Adam told Ellen, "We won't go into detail...it's private stuff, I'm technically the reason you met Portia." "Well not why I met her, but why we're together," Ellen stated.

352.title: WB govt to accommodate Ukraine-returned students in state colleges
352.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced on Thursday that her government will accommodate students who returned from Ukraine in state colleges. The sixth-year students will be allowed to undergo internships at government medical colleges. The fifth-year, fourth-year students will be allowed to undergo 'observing seats' in colleges in a manner that makes it 15-20 students per college.

353.title: 2 girls playing hide-and-seek die inside ice cream freezer in K'taka
353.article_body: Two girls died due to suffocation after hiding inside an abandoned ice cream freezer while playing hide-and-seek with friends in Karnataka's Mysuru on Wednesday, police said. According to the police, the girls entered the freezer, which was left unattended in their area. When they closed the door, it automatically got locked and they got trapped inside, police added.

354.title: Sweden has failed to integrate immigrants, crime has gone up: PM
354.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson said on Thursday that Sweden has failed to integrate immigrants over the last two decades, leading to increased gang violence in the country. Andersson made the remarks as she launched a series of initiatives to combat organised crime. Violent riots broke out in Sweden's Norrkoping city earlier this month after a politician burnt the Quran.

355.title: Rare, giant serpent-like creature washes up on New Zealand beach; pic goes viral
355.article_body: An extremely rare, giant serpent-like creature from the deep sea recently washed up on a New Zealand beach. A marine biologist investigated the discovery and identified it as an oarfish. A video shared online shows the creature lurking in shallow waters and a man can be heard saying in the background, "It feels like a shark."

356.title: Kuldeep records his best IPL bowling figures, takes 8 wickets in 2 matches vs ex-team KKR
356.article_body: DC chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav recorded his best bowling figures in IPL on Thursday by registering figures of 3-0-14-4 against KKR. The 27-year-old has now taken a total of eight wickets in two IPL 2022 matches against his former team KKR. Kuldeep's previous best bowling figures in IPL were 4-0-20-4, recorded against RR in IPL 2018.

357.title: Patently untrue: Minister on claim that T'gana CM was told to stay away from PM's event
357.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh dismissed KT Rama Rao's claim that PMO had instructed Telangana CM and his father K Chandrashekar Rao to stay away from PM Narendra Modi's programmes in Telangana last year and in February. "This is patently untrue. No such message was sent by the PMO. Infact, the CM...was expected at the events on 5th February," Singh tweeted.

358.title: Pochettino says Mbappe, himself will '100%' be at PSG next season
358.article_body: PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino said both he and Kylian Mbappe will "100%" be at the club next season. "This is football and we never know what might happen," the Argentinian said. Mbappe is out of contract this summer amid speculation over a move to Real Madrid. Regarding his own future Pochettino said that "there haven't been any concrete talks".

359.title: Excited to trade kicks with Akshay Kumar in 'Bade Miyan...': Tiger
359.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff has said that he is "very excited" about his upcoming film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan', which will also feature Akshay Kumar. Speaking about working with Akshay, Tiger said, "I am getting to work with one of my onscreen idols, Akshay Kumar sir, the original 'Khiladi'. So I'm just excited to trade kicks with him."

360.title: Major tragedy averted as IED found along highway in Jammu: Police
360.article_body: A major tragedy was averted after police recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) at Sidhra along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway on Thursday, J&K Police said. According to officials, the IED was planted along the highway by suspected terrorists. Police said the area was cordoned off immediately, and the bomb squad destroyed the explosive device through a controlled mechanism.

361.title: Amravati MP & husband seek home-made food in jail, file plea in court
361.article_body: Amravati Independent MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana have filed a petition in a sessions court in Mumbai seeking home-made food in jail. The plea's hearing will take place on April 29. The couple was arrested and sent to 14-day judicial custody on Sunday after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence.

362.title: Man shoots himself after killing ex-wife & daughter in the middle of the road in Bihar
362.article_body: In an incident reported from Bihar's capital Patna, a man first killed his divorced wife and daughter and later shot himself dead in the middle of the road. The incident took place on Thursday. The deceased accused has been identified as Rajeev. According to police, the murders seem to be the result of a family dispute.

363.title: Esha reacts as trolls say she looks like brother Bobby in new hairstyle
363.article_body: Esha Deol has reacted to trolls who said she looked like her brother Bobby Deol after her pictures with her new hairstyle were posted by the paparazzi. On Instagram Stories, Esha said her hair was "messy" because she shot for an action sequence. "If I do look like...Bobby in that hairdo...I'd like to thank you for the compliment," she added.

364.title: Barcelona to play 2023-24 season in Olympic Stadium
364.article_body: Barcelona will move to the Olympic Stadium for the 2023-24 season due to planned renovation of the Camp Nou. Work on the first and second tiers of the stadium will begin this June. The third tier of the 99,000 capacity stadium will be demolished in the summer of 2023. Barcelona said the renovation is expected to cost €1.5 billion.

365.title: Didn't know Jiju story will blow up, it wasn't real: Twitter user after Tata Motors' reply
365.article_body: After Tata Motors replied to a Twitter user who said his "jiju" was threatening to call off the wedding with his sister over delay in delivery of car, the user clarified he made up the story. "Guys I'm sorry but I didn't know that my Jiju story will blow up to this level...That was not real," he tweeted.

366.title: Russia fines Twitter 3 mn rubles for not deleting banned content
366.article_body: A Russian court fined Twitter three million rubles ($41,000) for not removing banned content from its platform, local media reported citing the court. The illegal content reportedly included posts with instructions on how to make Molotov cocktails, among others. Earlier, Russia fined Google the same amount for refusing to remove banned content from YouTube.

367.title: I dedicate my last years to health: Tata at inauguration of Assam cancer hospitals
367.article_body: Ratan Tata, who accompanied PM Narendra Modi in inaugurating cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday, said, "I dedicate my last years to health...Make Assam a state that recognises and is recognised by all." Earlier this year, the 84-year-old industrialist was conferred Assam's highest civilian award 'Assam Baibhav'. PM Modi on Thursday inaugurated seven cancer hospitals in Assam.

368.title: Future Retail directed to file reply on insolvency plea by May 12
368.article_body: National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has given Future Retail time till May 12 to file its reply to the insolvency plea filed by Bank of India. Future has defaulted on payment of ₹5,322.32 crore to a Bank of India-led consortium of lenders. This comes after Reliance called off its ₹24,713-crore deal with Future on Saturday.

369.title: Apple may make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in India this fiscal: Report
369.article_body: Apple's contract manufacturers in India are expected to make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in FY23,  The Economic Times reported. This will be almost five times the ₹10,000 crore worth of iPhones made by Apple's contract manufacturers Foxconn and Wistron in India in FY22, the report added. Earlier this month, Apple's manufacturing partner Foxconn began making iPhone 13 in India.

370.title: Bigg Boss 15's Vishal Kotian loses 15 kgs in 2.5 months, shares pic
370.article_body: Ex-Bigg Boss 15 contestant Vishal Kotian has revealed that he lost 15 kgs in 2.5 months after gaining weight during his low phase. "It was the 'Sultan' moment where Salman Khan looks in the mirror...realises that no I can't be this fat I have to get back...work harder," he stated. Vishal said he lost the weight for a role.

371.title: Israeli PM Bennett's family receives death threat, bullet in mail
371.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett's family has received a death threat and bullet in the mail for the second time in a week, police said on Thursday. According to an official, the target of the threats was Bennett's 17-year-old son Yoni, although the sender's identity hasn't been ascertained yet. Israeli authorities have increased the security arrangements for Bennett's family following threats.

372.title: China themselves haven't issued visas to us: India on suspending tourist visas
372.article_body: After India announced suspension of tourist visas issued to Chinese nationals, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "China themselves haven't issued visas to us, have suspended (visa issuance to India) since 2020." He stated that government was aware of the COVID-19 situation in Chinese cities like Shanghai, adding it wasn't an "opportune time" for resuming visa issuance.

373.title: Petition to remove Amber Heard from 'Aquaman 2' receives 2 million signatures
373.article_body: A petition to remove Amber Heard from 'Aquaman 2' has reached over two million signatures, as the defamation trial brought by her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp, continues. The petition says Heard "has been exposed as a domestic abuser by Johnny Depp". Depp claimed he was dropped from the 'Pirates of the Caribbean' franchise after allegations that he had abused Heard.

374.title: India doesn't need a national language, religion: Ex-J&K CM
374.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Thursday said that India doesn't need a national language or a national religion. "India is too diverse a country to have one national language. When you pick up an Indian currency note, how many languages do you find on it?" he said. India gives space to everybody, he added.

375.title: Google starts building 2nd largest campus outside US in Hyderabad
375.article_body: Google began building its largest campus outside of its US headquarters in Hyderabad's Gachibowli on Thursday. The 3 million-square-foot building will have a capacity to employ 14,000 people and is located on a 7.3-acre site. Google had acquired the land in 2019 after an agreement was signed between Google and Telangana's IT Minister KT Rama Rao in 2015.

376.title: US GDP falls 1.4% in Q1, 1st time since pandemic recession began
376.article_body: US GDP contracted 1.4% in the January-March 2022 quarter, the Department of Commerce said on Thursday. This was the first time that the US economy has contracted since the pandemic recession began two years ago. Department of Commerce's data showed personal consumption, the biggest part of the economy, rose 2.7% in Q1 2022 compared with 2.5% in Q4 2021.

377.title: Satellite pics suggest Russia using trained dolphins to protect naval base: Report
377.article_body: Russia deployed trained dolphins during its invasion of Ukraine to protect a Black Sea naval base, the US Naval Institute's news site USNI reported citing an analysis of satellite images. "Russian Navy has placed two dolphin pens at the entrance to Sevastopol harbour, sheltered just inside a sea wall," UNSI reported. "The pens were moved there in February," it added.

378.title: SBI denies no-dues certificate to farmer over 31 paise in Gujarat
378.article_body: The Gujarat High Court criticised SBI for withholding no-dues certificate of a farmer for pending dues worth 31 paise. The farmer needed the certificate for a land deal after he repaid the crop loan, TOI reported. "Outstanding of 31 paise? Do you know anything less than 50 paise is to be ignored?" Justice Bhargav Karia told SBI.

379.title: Shreya shares unseen pic with 'Scam 1992' co-star Pratik on his b'day
379.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary, taking to Instagram Stories, shared an unseen picture with her 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story' co-star Pratik Gandhi on his birthday on Thursday. Along with the picture, she wrote, "It's this jigar's birthday...Happy Birthdaaaaay my favourite nemesis." Shreya played the role of journalist Sucheta Dalal in the web series, which was directed by Hansal Mehta.

380.title: Lack of planning: BJP to Jharkhand govt over power cuts
380.article_body: The BJP has accused the JMM-led Jharkhand government of failing to provide a steady supply of electricity and adequate water to people amid the heatwave, calling it a result of "lack of planning". Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said, "Presently, Jharkhand requires 2,300 MW to 2,600 MW of power but is getting barely 1200 MW."

381.title: Imported oil first taxed by Centre then states: Pawar on fuel price hike
381.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that imported oil is first taxed by Centre and then states. Pawar added that Maharashtra decreased taxes on CNG due to which it suffered loss of ₹1,000 crore. He further said Centre should adopt uniform taxation policy on fuel in country.

382.title: Raj govt should review law & order: NCW chief on Dausa rape case
382.article_body: After a woman was allegedly gangraped and murdered in Rajasthan's Dausa, the National Commission for Women Chairperson, Rekha Sharma, said that the state government should review law and order. Sharma, who met police officials and the woman's family on Thursday, said, "People have no fear of law, it seems." She sought the arrest of all the accused at the earliest.

383.title: Superb VFX, brilliant acting & direction: Akshay on Ajay's Runway 34
383.article_body: Akshay Kumar praised 'Runway 34' on Twitter after the film's lead actor and director Ajay Devgn held a special screening for the actor. "Brother Ajay...What a thriller...superb VFX, brilliant acting and direction," he tweeted. "Amitabh Bachchan...effortless as always," he added. Akshay also praised actress Rakul Preet Singh's performance. "May the film gets its due," Akshay concluded.

384.title: Cong protects rioters: BJP after anti-Sikh riots accused Tytler meets Sonia
384.article_body: Reacting to 1984 anti-Sikh riots accused Jagdish Tytler's meeting with Congress' Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that the party "has always protected" and patronised rioters. "Congress will never stand for...victims of...riots...They have always rubbed salt on the wounds of...Sikh community," he added. The purpose of Tytler's visit, however, is not known.

385.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik seeks interim bail on medical grounds
385.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, has sought interim bail from a special PMLA court on medical grounds. He had informed the court that he was unwell due to kidney ailments and had swelling in his legs. Malik was arrested on February 23 in connection with a money laundering probe.

386.title: Have declared 16 AIIMS across India since 2014: PM Narendra Modi
386.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who visited Assam to lay foundation stone to various medical and developmental projects, said that his government has announced setting up of 16 AIIMS in the country after 2014. He added that AIIMS Guwahati was one of these projects. He tweeted, "Before 2014, there were only 7 AIIMS in the country. We declared 16 AIIMS across India."

387.title: 'Current health status: pissed off': Football superagent Raiola on reports of his death
387.article_body: After reports of his death surfaced online, football superagent Mino Raiola tweeted, "Current health status for the ones wondering: pissed off second time in 4 months they kill me. Seem also able to resuscitate." Raiola is currently admitted to the San Raffaele Hospital in Milan. Raiola's clients include Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Paul Pogba and Erling Haaland, among others.

388.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence arrested from West Bengal
388.article_body: One of the main accused in communal violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri has been arrested from West Bengal, a Delhi Police Crime Branch officer said. The accused, 31-year-old Farid alias Neetu, is "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community", the officer added. Post-riots, he escaped and hid in Tamluk, the officer further said.

389.title: Amber Heard's old chats with agent about break up with Elon Musk shown in court
389.article_body: Amber Heard spent time with Elon Musk while trying to reconcile with Johnny Depp, the ex-couple's agent Christian Carino said. Some of Carino's texts with Heard were shown in court, with Heard complaining about her break up with Musk in one. "Why'd you be sad if you weren't in love with him...You told me...you were just filling space," Carino replied.

390.title: DC to bowl first against KKR, KKR make 3 changes to their playing XI
390.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with Mitchell Marsh and Chetan Sakariya replacing Sarfaraz Khan and Khaleel Ahmed. KKR have made three changes, with Aaron Finch, Harshit Rana and Baba Indrajith being included in the side.

391.title: UP MLA scolds official for bulldozing house, says homes of poor shouldn't be razed
391.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing BJP MLA Ketki Singh scolding an official in UP's Ballia for bulldozing a poor family's home. Singh could be heard saying, "I said one thing...why didn't you respect it?...[You used bulldozer's strength...we'll use the words' strength]." Later, Singh said that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said that homes of poor shouldn't be razed.

392.title: Twitter reports revenue miss, user growth for Q1 days after Musk deal
392.article_body: Days after agreeing to sell to Elon Musk for $44 billion, Twitter released its earnings report for Q1 2022 on Thursday. Its daily active users number was up by 15.9% y-o-y to 229 million, compared with analysts' estimates of 226.8 million. However, Twitter's revenue was slightly below the estimated $1.23 billion. It earned $1.2 billion, an increase of 16% y-o-y.

393.title: Tempo driver arrested for raping 7-year-old girl in Mumbai
393.article_body: Mumbai police said that a tempo driver was arrested for luring a seven-year-old girl with chocolate and raping her in Ghatkopar. Officials said the 35-year-old accused was arrested within 24 hours of the incident. "Accused has been booked under section 376 (rape) and other relevant provisions of the IPC and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act," they added.

394.title: Elon Musk will not testify in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's defamation trial
394.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be testifying as a witness in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, the billionaire's lawyer Alex Spiro stated. Earlier, reports had said that Musk, who reportedly dated Amber in 2016, could be testifying in the court. Depp had alleged that Amber began dating Musk while she was still married to the actor.

395.title: Chennai man asks for sexual favours from woman during interview, held
395.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police on Wednesday arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a woman during a job interview at his firm. The accused told the woman that in order to be selected, she would have to accompany him when he travels for outstation work and would have to share the room with him, police said.

396.title: NCB seize 50 kg of heroin, ₹30 lakh cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar
396.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday seized about 50 kg of "high-quality" heroin, 47 kg of other suspected drugs and ₹30 lakh in cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar, the agency said on Thursday. The drugs were kept in backpacks, jute bags and wrapped in packets of e-commerce firms, said NCB Deputy Director General (operations) Sanjay Kumar Singh.

397.title: Attempt being made to disturb communal harmony in India: Pawar
397.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made to disturb communal harmony in the country. He said the Centre wasn't doing enough to control troublemakers in Delhi. Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence, he said, "There were attacks on a particular section of the society. There was a conspiracy to spoil peace in the country."

398.title: Prashant Kishor's proposal had nothing on leadership: P Chidambaram
398.article_body: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined Congress' offer to join the party, senior leader P Chidambaram said that Prashant Kishor's proposals to restore the party had nothing regarding its leadership. "PK plan had nothing on leadership issue. Didn't hear of any Priyanka for president proposal either," he said. Kishor rejected Congress' proposal after various meetings with Congress leaders.

399.title: BJP didn't fight enough, workers felt abandoned: WB BJP MP
399.article_body: West Bengal BJP MP Arjun Singh said BJP didn't win the state's Assembly polls last year because "it didn't fight enough". "BJP lost [the Assembly polls] because of poor candidate selection...Organisationally, the party is very weak. It is evident from what we recently saw in Asansol," Singh said. "Many workers felt they were abandoned [during] the post-poll violence," he added.

400.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates 7 new cancer hospitals in Assam
400.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, along with industrialist Ratan Tata, inaugurated a cancer care centre and seven new cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday. PM Modi said, "Cancer hospitals in Assam will augment healthcare capacities in Northeast [and] South Asia." He, however, added, "Hospitals are at your service, but I'll be happy if these new hospitals remain empty...I pray for your health."

401.title: Supplying Ukraine with weapons is threat to Europe's security: Russia
401.article_body: Russia said on Thursday that the West supplying arms to Ukraine poses a threat to Europe's security. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov's remarks came in response to UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss' comments on how countries should pledge more ammunition to Ukraine. Notably, Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of "lightning-fast" retaliatory strikes to any foreign interference in Ukraine war.

402.title: 'Jiju threatening to call off marriage' says man on delay in car delivery; Tata replies
402.article_body: Tata Motors responded to a man complaining over delay in his car's delivery. He tweeted, "It's [been] more than 2 months...dealer has no idea on delivery date. My sister's marriage is at stake, My jiju is angry and threatening to call off marriage." Tata sought his contact details and wrote, "We never want our customers to have such an experience."
